  53# %% Scene (image) class def.
  54class UscopeScene:
  55    """
  56    Replicate the common fluorescence microscopic image (frame or 'scene'). \n
  57
  58    This class simulates the bright objects with round and elongate shapes as the basic examples of imaged objects. \n
  59    The ratio behind development of this class - to get the ground truth images for image processing workflows tests. \n
  60    For more complex and useful cases, please, check the References.
  61
  62    References
  63    ----------
  64    In general, there is no references for implementation. For the used noise models, see the 'add_noise method'.
  65
  66    """
  67
  68    # Class parameters
  69    width: int = 4; height: int = 4; __warn_message: str = ""; max_pixel_value: Union[int, float] = 255; img_type = np.uint8
  70    acceptable_img_types: list = ['uint8', 'uint16', 'float', np.uint8, np.uint16, np.float64]
  71    shape: tuple = (height, width); fluo_objects: list = []; shape_types = ['mixed', 'round', 'r', 'ellipse', 'el']
  72    image: Optional[np.ndarray] = None  # now, image can be None as well as np.ndarray after generation
  73    __image_cleared: bool = True  # for tracking that the scene was cleared (zeroed)
  74    __available_coordinates: list = []; __binary_placement_mask: Optional[np.ndarray] = None
  75    denoised_image: Optional[np.ndarray] = None  # keep copy of an initial, free from noise image
  76    __restricted_coordinates: list = []; __noise_added: bool = False  # for tracking that the noise has been added
  77    __round_fl_obj = None; __ellipse_fl_obj = None  # placeholders for classes used for precompilation of methods by numba
  78    __cast_options: list = ["neg.norm.", "int8", "int16"]
  79
  80    def __init__(self, width: int, height: int, image_type: Union[str, np.uint8, np.uint16, np.float64] = 'uint8',
  81                 numba_precompile: bool = True):
  82        """
  83        Initialize the class wrapper for store the current "scene" or microscopic image.
  84
  85        Parameters
  86        ----------
  87        width : int \n
  88            Width of the scene in pixels. \n
  89        height : int \n
  90            Height of the scene in pixels. \n
  91        image_type : str | np.uint8 | np.uint16 | np.float64, optional \n
  92            Image type, for supported ones see the acceptable types. The default is 'uint8'. \n
  93        numba_precompile : bool, optional \n
  94            Flag for precompilation of computing methods using 'numba' library (if it's installed). The default is True.
  95
  96        Raises
  97        ------
  98        ValueError \n
  99            If provided parameters are inconsistent, e.g. width or height < 2. \n
 100
 101        Returns
 102        -------
 103        None.
 104
 105        """
 106        # Check provided width and height
 107        if width < 4 or height < 4:
 108            raise ValueError(f"Provided dimensions ({width}x{height}) is less than 4")
 109        if width > 10000 or height > 10000:
 110            __warn_message = f"Provided dimensions ({width}x{height}) pixels are unrealistic for the common image"
 111            warnings.warn(__warn_message)
 112        self.width = width; self.height = height
 113        # Check an image type
 114        if image_type not in self.acceptable_img_types:
 115            raise ValueError(f"Provided image type '{image_type}' not in the acceptable list of types: " + str(self.acceptable_img_types))
 116        else:
 117            if image_type == 'uint8' or image_type == np.uint8:
 118                self.max_pixel_value = np.iinfo(np.uint8).max; self.img_type = np.uint8
 119            elif image_type == 'uint16' or image_type == np.uint16:
 120                self.max_pixel_value = np.iinfo(np.uint16).max; self.img_type = np.uint16
 121            elif image_type == 'float' or image_type == np.float64:
 122                self.max_pixel_value = 1.0; self.img_type = np.float64
 123        # Initialize zero scene
 124        self.image = np.zeros(shape=(height, width), dtype=self.img_type)
 125        self.__image_cleared = True; self.shape = (self.height, self.width)
 126        self.methods_precompiled = False  # flag for retaining if the objects shape calculation methods precompiled
 127        # Precompile of calculation methods for making calculations more convenient
 128        if numba_precompile and numba_installed:
 129            self.__round_fl_obj = FluorObj(typical_size=2.02, center_shifts=(0.1, -0.2))
 130            self.__ellipse_fl_obj = FluorObj(typical_size=(2.02, 1.52, np.pi / 3.0), center_shifts=(-0.1, 0.2), shape_type='ellipse')
 131            self.precompile_methods()
 132
 133    # %% Objects specification / generation
 134    @classmethod
 135    def get_random_objects(cls, mean_size: Union[Real, tuple], size_std: Union[Real, tuple], intensity_range: tuple,
 136                           n_objects: int = 2, shapes: str = 'round', image_type: Union[str, np.uint8, np.uint16, np.float64] = 'uint8',
 137                           verbose_info: bool = False, accelerated: bool = False) -> tuple:
 138        """
 139        Generate objects with randomized shape sizes, for shape types: 'round', 'ellipse', 'mixed' - last one for randomized choice
 140        between 2 first ones.
 141
 142        Objects should be instances of FluorObj() class from this module.
 143
 144        Parameters
 145        ----------
 146        mean_size : Union[Real, tuple] \n
 147            Mean size(-s) of randomized objects. Integer or float is supposed to be used for round particles, tuple - for ellipse. \n
 148        size_std : Union[Real, tuple] \n
 149            Standard deviation of mean size(-s). \n
 150        intensity_range : tuple \n
 151            (Min, Max) intensities for randomized choice of the maximum intensity along the profile. \n
 152        n_objects : int, optional \n
 153            Number of generated objects. The default is 2. \n
 154        shapes : str, optional \n
 155            Implemented in FluorObj() shapes: 'round', 'ellipse' or 'mixed' them (randomly selected). The default is 'round'. \n
 156        image_type : Union[str, np.uint8, np.uint16, np.float64], optional \n
 157            Image type of the scene on which the objects will be placed and cast to. The default is 'uint8'. \n
 158        verbose_info : bool, optional \n
 159            Flag for printing out verbose information about the generation progress (use it for many objects generation).
 160            The default is False. \n
 161        accelerated : bool, optional \n
 162            Flag for attempting acceleration of objects shape calculation by using 'numba' library compilation. \n
 163
 164        Raises
 165        ------
 166        ValueError  \n
 167            See the provided description in the exception traceback. \n
 168
 169        Returns
 170        -------
 171        tuple
 172            Packed instances of FluorObj() class with the generated objects.
 173
 174        """
 175        if verbose_info:
 176            t_ov_1 = time.perf_counter()
 177        # Check input parameters for consistency
 178        if shapes not in cls.shape_types:
 179            raise ValueError(f"Please provide the supported shape type for generation from a list: {cls.shape_types}")
 180        max_intensity = max(intensity_range); raise_exception = False  # define max provided intensity
 181        if image_type == 'uint8' or image_type == np.uint8:
 182            if max_intensity > np.iinfo(np.uint8).max:
 183                raise_exception = True
 184        elif image_type == 'uint16' or image_type == np.uint16:
 185            if max_intensity > np.iinfo(np.uint16).max:
 186                raise_exception = True
 187        if raise_exception:
 188            raise ValueError(f"Max intensity from the range {intensity_range} is incompatible with the provided image type {image_type}")
 189        fl_objects = []  # for storing generated objects
 190        r = None; r_std = None  # default parameters for round objects
 191        # Printout warning if the method called with parameters leading to the long calculations
 192        if verbose_info and not accelerated:
 193            if np.min(mean_size) >= 4.0 and n_objects >= 10:
 194                print(f"***** Note that the overall generation will take more than ~ {round(1.075*n_objects, 1)} sec. *****", flush=True)
 195        elif verbose_info and accelerated:
 196            if np.min(mean_size) >= 4.0 and n_objects >= 34:
 197                print(f"***** Note that the overall generation will take more than ~ {round(0.3*n_objects, 1)} sec. *****", flush=True)
 198        # Generation loop
 199        for i in range(n_objects):
 200            if verbose_info:
 201                t1 = time.perf_counter()
 202                print(f"Started generation of #{i+1} object", flush=True)
 203            if shapes == 'mixed':
 204                shape_type, r, r_std = get_random_shape_props(mean_size, size_std)
 205            else:
 206                shape_type = shapes
 207            # Random selection of object parameters: shifts, max intensity
 208            i_shift, j_shift = get_random_central_shifts(); fl_intensity = get_random_max_intensity(intensity_range)
 209            # Round shaped object generation
 210            if shape_type == 'round' or shape_type == 'r':
 211                radius = get_radius_gaussian(r, r_std, mean_size, size_std)  # Gaussian-distributed random value
 212                # Generating the object and calculating its shape, cast and crop it
 213                fl_object = FluorObj(typical_size=2.0*radius, center_shifts=(i_shift, j_shift)); fl_object.get_shape(accelerated=accelerated)
 214                fl_object.crop_shape(); fl_object.get_casted_shape(max_pixel_value=fl_intensity, image_type=image_type)
 215                fl_objects.append(fl_object)
 216            # Ellipse shaped object generation
 217            elif shape_type == 'ellipse' or shape_type == 'el':
 218                ellipse_sizes = get_ellipse_sizes(mean_size, size_std)
 219                fl_object = FluorObj(typical_size=ellipse_sizes, center_shifts=(i_shift, j_shift), shape_type='ellipse')
 220                fl_object.get_shape(accelerated=accelerated); fl_object.crop_shape()  # calculate normalized shape and crop it
 221                fl_object.get_casted_shape(max_pixel_value=fl_intensity, image_type=image_type); fl_objects.append(fl_object)
 222            if verbose_info:
 223                print_out_elapsed_t(t1, operation=f"Generation of obj. #{i+1} out of {n_objects}")
 224        if verbose_info:
 225            print_out_elapsed_t(t_ov_1, operation="Overall generation")
 226        return tuple(fl_objects)
 227
 228    def get_objects_acc(self, mean_size: Union[Real, tuple], size_std: Union[Real, tuple], intensity_range: tuple,
 229                        n_objects: int = 2, shapes: str = 'round', image_type: Union[str, np.uint8, np.uint16, np.float64] = 'uint8',
 230                        verbose_info: bool = False) -> tuple:
 231        """
 232        Generate objects with randomized shape sizes, for shape types: 'round', 'ellipse', 'mixed' - last one for randomized choice
 233        between 2 first ones.
 234
 235        This method is accelerated by utilizing the 'numba' library compilation of called inside methods. \n
 236        Objects should be instances of FluorObj() class from this module.
 237
 238        Parameters
 239        ----------
 240        mean_size : Union[Real, tuple]  \n
 241            Mean size(-s) of randomized objects. Integer or float is supposed to be used for round particles, tuple - for ellipse. \n
 242        size_std : Union[Real, tuple]  \n
 243            Standard deviation of mean size(-s). \n
 244        intensity_range : tuple  \n
 245            (Min, Max) intensities for randomized choice of the maximum intensity along the profile.  \n
 246        n_objects : int, optional  \n
 247            Number of generated objects. The default is 2.  \n
 248        shapes : str, optional  \n
 249            Implemented in FluorObj() shapes: 'round', 'ellipse' or 'mixed' them (randomly selected). The default is 'round'.   \n
 250        image_type : Union[str, np.uint8, np.uint16, np.float64], optional  \n
 251            Image type of the scene on which the objects will be placed and cast to. The default is 'uint8'.  \n
 252        verbose_info : bool, optional  \n
 253            Flag for printing out verbose information about the generation progress (use it for many objects generation).
 254            The default is False. \n
 255
 256        Raises
 257        ------
 258        ValueError \n
 259            See the provided description in the exception traceback. \n
 260
 261        Returns
 262        -------
 263        tuple
 264            Packed instances of FluorObj() class with the generated objects.
 265
 266        """
 267        if verbose_info:
 268            t_ov_1 = time.perf_counter()
 269        # Checking input values for consistency
 270        if shapes not in self.shape_types:
 271            raise ValueError(f"Please provide the supported shape type for generation from a list: {self.shape_types}")
 272        if not numba_installed:
 273            raise ValueError("Method can be called if only 'numba' package is installed")
 274        max_intensity = max(intensity_range); raise_exception = False  # define max provided intensity
 275        if image_type == 'uint8' or image_type == np.uint8:
 276            if max_intensity > np.iinfo(np.uint8).max:
 277                raise_exception = True
 278        elif image_type == 'uint16' or image_type == np.uint16:
 279            if max_intensity > np.iinfo(np.uint16).max:
 280                raise_exception = True
 281        if raise_exception:
 282            raise ValueError(f"Max intensity from the range {intensity_range} is incompatible with the provided image type {image_type}")
 283        # Generation parameters
 284        fl_objects = []  # for storing generated objects
 285        r = None; r_std = None  # default parameters for round objects
 286        # Generation loop
 287        for i in range(n_objects):
 288            if verbose_info:
 289                t1 = time.perf_counter()
 290                print(f"Started generation of #{i+1} object", flush=True)
 291            if shapes == 'mixed':
 292                shape_type, r, r_std = get_random_shape_props(mean_size, size_std)
 293            else:
 294                shape_type = shapes
 295            # Random selection of object parameters: shifts, max intensity
 296            i_shift, j_shift = get_random_central_shifts(); fl_intensity = get_random_max_intensity(intensity_range)
 297            # Round shaped object generation
 298            if shape_type == 'round' or shape_type == 'r':
 299                radius = get_radius_gaussian(r, r_std, mean_size, size_std)  # Gaussian-distributed random value
 300                # Generating the object and calculating its shape, cast and crop it
 301                fl_object = FluorObj(typical_size=2.0*radius, center_shifts=(i_shift, j_shift)); fl_object.get_shape(accelerated=True)
 302                fl_object.crop_shape(); fl_object.get_casted_shape(max_pixel_value=fl_intensity, image_type=image_type)
 303                fl_objects.append(fl_object)
 304            # Ellipse shaped object generation
 305            elif (shape_type == 'ellipse' or shape_type == 'el') and isinstance(mean_size, tuple) and isinstance(size_std, tuple):
 306                ellipse_sizes = get_ellipse_sizes(mean_size, size_std)
 307                fl_object = FluorObj(typical_size=ellipse_sizes, center_shifts=(i_shift, j_shift), shape_type='ellipse')
 308                fl_object.get_shape(accelerated=True); fl_object.crop_shape()  # calculate normalized shape and crop it
 309                fl_object.get_casted_shape(max_pixel_value=fl_intensity, image_type=image_type); fl_objects.append(fl_object)
 310            if verbose_info:
 311                print_out_elapsed_t(t1, operation=f"Generation of obj. #{i+1} out of {n_objects}")
 312        if verbose_info:
 313            print_out_elapsed_t(t_ov_1, operation="Overall generation")
 314        return tuple(fl_objects)
 315
 316    def precompile_methods(self, verbose_info: bool = False) -> bool:
 317        """
 318        Precompile computation methods in 'get_random_objects' chain of methods calls.
 319
 320        Parameters
 321        ----------
 322        verbose_info : bool, optional  \n
 323            Flag for more prints out about calculations timing and status. The default is False. \n
 324
 325        Returns
 326        -------
 327        bool  \n
 328            - True, if methods have been precompiled (prerequisite - 'numba' library installed).
 329
 330        """
 331        if not self.methods_precompiled:
 332            if verbose_info:
 333                t_ov_1 = time.perf_counter()
 334            if self.__round_fl_obj is None or self.__ellipse_fl_obj:
 335                self.__round_fl_obj = FluorObj(typical_size=2.02, center_shifts=(0.1, -0.2))
 336                self.__ellipse_fl_obj = FluorObj(typical_size=(2.02, 1.52, np.pi / 3.0), center_shifts=(-0.1, 0.2), shape_type='ellipse')
 337            self.__round_fl_obj.get_shape(accelerated=True); self.__ellipse_fl_obj.get_shape(accelerated=True)
 338            self.methods_precompiled = True
 339            if verbose_info:
 340                print_out_elapsed_t(t_ov_1, "*** Precompilation")
 341        return self.methods_precompiled
 342
 343    @staticmethod
 344    def get_round_objects(mean_size: float, size_std: float, intensity_range: tuple, n_objects: int = 2, shape_r_type: str = 'mixed',
 345                          image_type: Union[str, np.uint8, np.uint16, np.float64] = 'uint8') -> tuple:
 346        """
 347        Generate round shaped objects (as FluorObj class instances) with continuous shapes (see FluorObj class documentation).
 348
 349        Parameters
 350        ----------
 351        mean_size : float  \n
 352            Mean size of objects in pixels.  \n
 353        size_std : float  \n
 354            Standard deviation of objects sizes. \n
 355        intensity_range : tuple \n
 356            Intensity range for selection of maximum object intensity. \n
 357        n_objects : int, optional \n
 358            Number of generated objects. The default is 2. \n
 359        shape_r_type : str, optional \n
 360            Acceptable by FluorObj class round and computed shape types. The default is 'mixed'. \n
 361        image_type : Union[str, np.uint8, np.uint16, np.float64], optional \n
 362            Type of image used for a scene. The default is 'uint8'. \n
 363
 364        Returns
 365        -------
 366        tuple  \n
 367            Generated objects.
 368
 369        """
 370        fl_objects = []; min_intensity, max_intensity = intensity_range
 371        shape_types = FluorObj.valuable_round_shapes[:]; random.shuffle(shape_types)
 372        for i in range(n_objects):
 373            # Random selection of central shifts for placement
 374            i_shift = round(random.random(), 3); j_shift = round(random.random(), 3)  # random generation of central pixel shifts
 375            # Checking that shifts are generated in the subpixel range and correcting it if not
 376            if i_shift >= 1.0:
 377                i_shift -= round(random.random(), 3)*0.25
 378            if j_shift >= 1.0:
 379                j_shift -= round(random.random(), 3)*0.25
 380            radius = abs(random.gauss(mu=mean_size, sigma=size_std))  # get the abs. value of radius from Gaussian distribution
 381            # Random selection of max intensity for the profile casting
 382            if isinstance(min_intensity, int) and isinstance(max_intensity, int):
 383                fl_intensity = random.randrange(min_intensity, max_intensity, 1)
 384            elif isinstance(min_intensity, float) and isinstance(max_intensity, float):
 385                fl_intensity = random.uniform(a=min_intensity, b=max_intensity)
 386            # Checking generated radius for consistency
 387            if radius < 0.5:
 388                radius += random.uniform(a=1.0-radius, b=1.0)
 389            # If mixed type, selecting randomly the shape type
 390            if shape_r_type == 'mixed':
 391                shape_sel_type = random.choice(shape_types)
 392            else:
 393                shape_sel_type = shape_r_type
 394            # Generating the round shaped object with continuous function used for shape calculation
 395            fl_object = FluorObj(typical_size=2.0*radius, center_shifts=(i_shift, j_shift), border_type='co', shape_method=shape_sel_type)
 396            fl_object.get_shape(); fl_object.crop_shape()  # calculate normalized shape and crop it
 397            fl_object.get_casted_shape(max_pixel_value=fl_intensity, image_type=image_type); fl_objects.append(fl_object)
 398        return tuple(fl_objects)
 399
 400    # %% Randomly assigning coordinates for objects
 401    def set_random_places(self, fluo_objects: tuple = (), overlapping: bool = True, touching: bool = True,
 402                          only_within_scene: bool = False, verbose_info: bool = False) -> tuple:
 403        """
 404        Set random coordinates within scene (or partially outside) for provided objects.
 405
 406        Parameters
 407        ----------
 408        fluo_objects : tuple, optional \n
 409            Tuple with generated instances of FluorObj() class. The default is (). \n
 410        overlapping : bool, optional \n
 411            If True, the coordinates will be randomly selected from available ones. \n
 412            If False, the largest object will be placed firstly, and others will be placed after with checking that the object to be placed
 413            are not intersected with the already placed objects on previous iterations.  \n
 414            The default is True. \n
 415        touching : bool, optional \n
 416            Flag for allowing objects to touch by their border pixels. Note that if overlapping is True, this flag ignored.
 417            The default is True. \n
 418        only_within_scene : bool, optional
 419            If True, the objects will be placed completely within (inside) the scene. \n
 420            If False, objects may lay partially outside the scene. The default is False. \n
 421        verbose_info : bool, optional \n
 422            Printing out verbose information about performance of placement. The default is False. \n
 423
 424        Returns
 425        -------
 426        tuple
 427            With the placed objects.
 428
 429        """
 430        if len(fluo_objects) > 0:
 431            # For making verbose information printouts, check the time performance of placement logic
 432            if verbose_info:
 433                t1 = time.perf_counter()
 434            h, w = self.image.shape  # height and width of the image for setting the range of coordinates random selection
 435            if not overlapping:
 436                filtered_fluo_obj = []  # storing the objects in the list for excluding the not placed objects if they are not overlapped
 437                additional_border = 0
 438                if not touching:
 439                    additional_border = 1  # additional 1 pixel for excluding the pixels close to the object borders
 440            # If only_within_scene, sort out the objects based on their sizes and place first the largest one, if not - the smallest one
 441            if not overlapping or (overlapping and only_within_scene):
 442                fluo_objects = list(fluo_objects)  # convert for applying embedded sorting algorithm
 443            if only_within_scene:
 444                fluo_objects.sort(reverse=True)
 445            elif not overlapping and not only_within_scene:
 446                fluo_objects.sort()
 447            # Printing out the warning messages (obtained for some useful cases and flags)
 448            if len(fluo_objects) > 1 and verbose_info and fluo_objects[0].profile is not None:
 449                h_fl_obj, w_fl_obj = fluo_objects[0].profile.shape  # get the largest object sizes
 450                if len(fluo_objects) >= 5 or (h_fl_obj > 10 and w_fl_obj > 10):
 451                    if not numba_installed:
 452                        print("NOTE: Placing algorithm can take quite a long time (depending on the size of objects and scene). \n"
 453                              + "For acceleration of it install library 'numba' with the recommended version >= 0.57.1", flush=True)
 454                    print(f"***** Placing of {len(fluo_objects)} objects started *****", flush=True)
 455            if verbose_info and not overlapping:
 456                if not numba_installed:
 457                    if h*w > 35000:
 458                        print("Note that placing algorithm can take long time, starting from several dozens of seconds", flush=True)
 459                else:
 460                    if h*w > 110000:
 461                        print("Note that placing algorithm can take long time, starting from several dozens of seconds", flush=True)
 462            # Placing loop for provided objects (set random placing coordinates of the upper left pixel for the objects)
 463            placed_objects = 0  # for printing out the number of placed objects
 464            for fluo_obj in fluo_objects:
 465                if fluo_obj.profile is not None:
 466                    if verbose_info:
 467                        t_obj = time.perf_counter(); print(f"Started placing of #{placed_objects+1} object", flush=True)
 468                    h_fl_obj, w_fl_obj = fluo_obj.profile.shape  # get object sizes
 469                    fluo_obj.set_image_sizes(self.image.shape)  # force to account for the used scene shape
 470                    # Placement logic, if overlapping is allowed - just random spreading objects on the scene
 471                    if overlapping or (not overlapping and self.__binary_placement_mask is None):
 472                        # Depending on the flag, defining smallest and largest coordinates (outside the scene borders or only inside)
 473                        if only_within_scene:
 474                            i_smallest = 1; j_smallest = 1; i_largest = h-h_fl_obj-1; j_largest = w-w_fl_obj-1
 475                        else:
 476                            # smallest placing coordinate = half of object sizes - 1 pixel, analogous for largest coordinates
 477                            i_smallest = -(h_fl_obj // 2) + 1; j_smallest = -(w_fl_obj // 2) + 1
 478                            i_largest = (h - h_fl_obj // 2) - 2; j_largest = (w - w_fl_obj // 2) - 2
 479                        # Random selection of i, j coordinates below
 480                        i_obj = random.randrange(i_smallest, i_largest, 1); j_obj = random.randrange(j_smallest, j_largest, 1)
 481                        # Not overlapping, below - place the largest object and create the mask for preventing the overlapping
 482                        if not overlapping:
 483                            # Generate the meshgrid of all available for placing coordinates (depending on the placement flag)
 484                            if not only_within_scene and len(fluo_objects) > 1:
 485                                if not numba_installed:
 486                                    self.__available_coordinates = [(i_a, j_a) for i_a in range(i_smallest, i_largest)
 487                                                                    for j_a in range(j_smallest, j_largest)]
 488                                else:
 489                                    generate_coordinates_list(1, 3, 1, 3)  # precompile method for acceleration further calls
 490                                    self.__available_coordinates = generate_coordinates_list(i_smallest, i_largest, j_smallest, j_largest)
 491                            else:
 492                                # Below - keep the possible placement close to bottom and right edges of the scene and remove them later
 493                                if not numba_installed:
 494                                    self.__available_coordinates = [(i_a, j_a) for i_a in range(i_smallest, h-2)
 495                                                                    for j_a in range(j_smallest, w-2)]
 496                                    self.__restricted_coordinates = [(i_a, j_a) for i_a in range(i_smallest, i_largest)
 497                                                                     for j_a in range(j_smallest, j_largest)]
 498                                else:
 499                                    generate_coordinates_list(1, 3, 1, 3)  # precompile method for acceleration further calls
 500                                    self.__available_coordinates = generate_coordinates_list(i_smallest, h-2, j_smallest, w-2)
 501                                    self.__restricted_coordinates = generate_coordinates_list(i_smallest, i_largest, j_smallest, j_largest)
 502                            # Generate the binary mask (instead of the real image or scene) for placing more than 1 object
 503                            if len(fluo_objects) > 1:
 504                                self.__binary_placement_mask = np.zeros(shape=self.image.shape, dtype='uint8')
 505                                if not numba_installed:
 506                                    self.__binary_placement_mask = set_binary_mask_coords_in_loop(self.__binary_placement_mask,
 507                                                                                                  i_obj-additional_border,
 508                                                                                                  i_obj+h_fl_obj+additional_border,
 509                                                                                                  self.image.shape[0],
 510                                                                                                  j_obj-additional_border,
 511                                                                                                  j_obj+w_fl_obj+additional_border,
 512                                                                                                  self.image.shape[1])
 513                                else:
 514                                    set_binary_mask_coordinates(np.zeros((2, 2)), 0, 1, 2, 0, 1, 2)  # precompilation
 515                                    self.__binary_placement_mask = set_binary_mask_coordinates(self.__binary_placement_mask,
 516                                                                                               i_obj-additional_border,
 517                                                                                               i_obj+h_fl_obj+additional_border,
 518                                                                                               self.image.shape[0],
 519                                                                                               j_obj-additional_border,
 520                                                                                               j_obj+w_fl_obj+additional_border,
 521                                                                                               self.image.shape[1])
 522                                # Exclude the coordinates occupied by the placed object from the available choices for further placements
 523                                if not numba_installed:
 524                                    coordinates_for_del = [(i_exc, j_exc)
 525                                                           for i_exc in range(i_obj-additional_border, i_obj+h_fl_obj+additional_border)
 526                                                           for j_exc in range(j_obj-additional_border, j_obj+w_fl_obj+additional_border)]
 527                                else:
 528                                    coordinates_for_del = generate_coordinates_list(i_obj-additional_border, i_obj+h_fl_obj+additional_border,
 529                                                                                    j_obj-additional_border, j_obj+w_fl_obj+additional_border)
 530                                self.__available_coordinates = delete_coordinates_from_list(coordinates_for_del,
 531                                                                                            self.__available_coordinates)
 532                            filtered_fluo_obj.append(fluo_obj)  # storing the 1st placed and not overlapped objects
 533                            random.shuffle(self.__available_coordinates)  # shuffle available coordinates
 534                        fluo_obj.set_coordinates((i_obj, j_obj)); placed_objects += 1  # set random place of the object within the image
 535                        if verbose_info:
 536                            print("# of placed objects:", placed_objects, "out of", len(fluo_objects), flush=True)
 537                            print_out_elapsed_t(t_obj, operation="Placing 1st object")
 538                    else:
 539                        # Trying to place the object in the randomly selected from remaining coordinates place and checking if there is no
 540                        # intersections with already placed objects, regulate # of attempts to place below in the while condition
 541                        if verbose_info:
 542                            t_obj = time.perf_counter()
 543                        i_attempts = 0; placed = False; available_correcting_coordinates = self.__available_coordinates[:]
 544                        # Adapting max number of attempts
 545                        if 0 < len(available_correcting_coordinates) < 50:
 546                            max_attempts = len(available_correcting_coordinates)
 547                        else:
 548                            max_attempts = 50  # limiting max number of attempts to find suitable coordinates
 549                        # Trying to place the object and check for intersections with the other ones
 550                        border_coordinates_deleted = False
 551                        while (not placed and i_attempts < max_attempts) and len(available_correcting_coordinates) > 0:
 552                            overlapped = False  # flag for checking if the object is overlapped with the occupied place on a binary mask
 553                            # randomly choose from the available coordinates
 554                            if not only_within_scene:
 555                                i_obj, j_obj = random.choice(available_correcting_coordinates)
 556                            else:
 557                                if not border_coordinates_deleted:
 558                                    i_obj, j_obj = random.choice(self.__restricted_coordinates)
 559                                else:
 560                                    i_obj, j_obj = random.choice(available_correcting_coordinates)
 561                            # Vectorized form of the overlapping check
 562                            i_max, j_max = self.__binary_placement_mask.shape; i_max -= 1; j_max -= 1
 563                            # Define the region of the placement mask for checking
 564                            if i_obj-additional_border < 0:
 565                                i_start = 0
 566                            else:
 567                                i_start = i_obj - additional_border
 568                            if j_obj-additional_border < 0:
 569                                j_start = 0
 570                            else:
 571                                j_start = j_obj - additional_border
 572                            if i_obj + h_fl_obj + additional_border > i_max:
 573                                i_finish = i_max
 574                            else:
 575                                i_finish = i_obj + h_fl_obj + additional_border
 576                            if j_obj + w_fl_obj + additional_border > j_max:
 577                                j_finish = j_max
 578                            else:
 579                                j_finish = j_obj + w_fl_obj + additional_border
 580                            if np.max(self.__binary_placement_mask[i_start:i_finish, j_start:j_finish]) > 0:
 581                                overlapped = True; placed = False; i_attempts += 1
 582                                try:
 583                                    available_correcting_coordinates.remove((i_obj, j_obj))
 584                                    self.__available_coordinates.remove((i_obj, j_obj))
 585                                except ValueError:
 586                                    pass
 587                            # Check that object placed and if not, delete border pixels for placing (long-lasting function)
 588                            if not overlapped:
 589                                placed = True; break
 590                            else:
 591                                # Prevent placing out of scene by removing from available coordinates
 592                                if only_within_scene:
 593                                    if not numba_installed:
 594                                        coordinates_for_del = [(i_exc, j_exc) for i_exc in range(h-h_fl_obj, h-2) for j_exc in range(1, w-2)]
 595                                        coordinates_for_del += [(i_exc, j_exc) for i_exc in range(1, h-2) for j_exc in range(w-w_fl_obj, w-2)]
 596                                    else:
 597                                        coordinates_for_del = generate_coordinates_list(h-h_fl_obj, h-2, 1, w-2)
 598                                        coordinates_for_del += generate_coordinates_list(1, h-2, w-w_fl_obj, w-2)
 599                                    available_correcting_coordinates = delete_coordinates_from_list(coordinates_for_del,
 600                                                                                                    available_correcting_coordinates)
 601                                    border_coordinates_deleted = True
 602                            if len(available_correcting_coordinates) == 0:
 603                                placed = False; break
 604                        # Exclude the coordinates occupied by the placed object from the meshgrid (list with coordinates pares)
 605                        if placed:
 606                            if not numba_installed:
 607                                coordinates_for_del = [(i_exc, j_exc)
 608                                                       for i_exc in range(i_obj-additional_border, i_obj+h_fl_obj+additional_border)
 609                                                       for j_exc in range(j_obj-additional_border, j_obj+w_fl_obj+additional_border)]
 610                            else:
 611                                coordinates_for_del = generate_coordinates_list(i_obj-additional_border, i_obj+h_fl_obj+additional_border,
 612                                                                                j_obj-additional_border, j_obj+w_fl_obj+additional_border)
 613                            for del_coord in coordinates_for_del:
 614                                try:
 615                                    self.__available_coordinates.remove(del_coord)
 616                                    if only_within_scene:
 617                                        self.__restricted_coordinates.remove(del_coord)
 618                                except ValueError:
 619                                    pass
 620                            # Exclude placed object from binary placement mask
 621                            if not numba_installed:
 622                                self.__binary_placement_mask = set_binary_mask_coords_in_loop(self.__binary_placement_mask,
 623                                                                                              i_obj, i_obj+h_fl_obj,
 624                                                                                              self.image.shape[0],
 625                                                                                              j_obj, j_obj+w_fl_obj,
 626                                                                                              self.image.shape[1])
 627                            else:
 628                                self.__binary_placement_mask = set_binary_mask_coordinates(self.__binary_placement_mask,
 629                                                                                           i_obj, i_obj+h_fl_obj,
 630                                                                                           self.image.shape[0],
 631                                                                                           j_obj, j_obj+w_fl_obj,
 632                                                                                           self.image.shape[1])
 633                            fluo_obj.set_coordinates((i_obj, j_obj))  # if found place, place the object
 634                            filtered_fluo_obj.append(fluo_obj); placed_objects += 1  # collect for returning only placed objects
 635                            if verbose_info:
 636                                print("# of placed objects:", placed_objects, "out of", len(fluo_objects), flush=True)
 637                                print_out_elapsed_t(t_obj, operation=f"Placing #{placed_objects} object")
 638            if not overlapping:
 639                fluo_objects = tuple(filtered_fluo_obj)  # convert list -> tuple for returning only placed objects
 640                # plt.figure("Binary Placement Mask"); plt.imshow(self.__binary_placement_mask)  # plot the occupied places by the objects
 641            if verbose_info:
 642                print_out_elapsed_t(t1, operation=f"Placing of {placed_objects} objects")
 643        return fluo_objects
 644
 645    # %% Put objects on the scene
 646    def put_objects_on(self, fluo_objects: tuple = (), save_objects: bool = True, save_only_objects_inside: bool = False,
 647                       rewrite_objects: bool = False):
 648        """
 649        Put the provided objects on the scene by checking pixelwise the provided profiles and in the case of intersection of
 650        two objects profiles, selecting the maximum intensity from them.
 651
 652        Parameters
 653        ----------
 654        fluo_objects : tuple, optional  \n
 655            Fluorescent objects, instances of FluorObj class, packed in a tuple. The default is (). \n
 656        save_objects : bool, optional \n
 657            If True, will save (append) objects in the class attribute 'fluo_objects'. The default is True. \n
 658            Note that, if it's False, then before placing the objects, the scene will be cleared
 659            (stored before objects will be removed from it). \n
 660        save_only_objects_inside : bool, optional \n
 661            Save in the class attribute ('fluo_objects') only objects that are inside the image. The default is False. \n
 662        rewrite_objects : bool, optional \n
 663            If True, it forces to substitute stored objects in the class attribute 'fluo_objects' with the provided ones.
 664            The default is False. \n
 665
 666        Returns
 667        -------
 668        None.
 669
 670        """
 671        if len(fluo_objects) > 0:
 672            if len(self.fluo_objects) == 0 or not save_objects:
 673                self.clear_scene()  # clear the scene before placing the objects only if there are no saved objects and the flag is False
 674            for fluo_obj in fluo_objects:
 675                if fluo_obj.within_image and fluo_obj.casted_profile is not None and self.image is not None:
 676                    i_start, j_start = fluo_obj.external_upper_coordinates; i_size, j_size = fluo_obj.casted_profile.shape
 677                    h, w = self.image.shape  # for checking that the placing happening within the image
 678                    k = 0  # for counting on the profile
 679                    for i in range(i_start, i_start+i_size):
 680                        m = 0  # refresh starting column for counting on the object profile
 681                        for j in range(j_start, j_start+j_size):
 682                            if 0 <= i < h and 0 <= j < w:
 683                                if self.img_type == np.uint8 or self.img_type == np.uint16:
 684                                    if self.image[i, j] == 0:
 685                                        self.image[i, j] = fluo_obj.casted_profile[k, m]
 686                                    else:
 687                                        self.image[i, j] = max(self.image[i, j], fluo_obj.casted_profile[k, m])
 688                                else:  # float image type
 689                                    if self.image[i, j] < 1E-9:
 690                                        self.image[i, j] = fluo_obj.casted_profile[k, m]
 691                                    else:
 692                                        self.image[i, j] = max(self.image[i, j], fluo_obj.casted_profile[k, m])
 693                                if self.__image_cleared:
 694                                    self.__image_cleared = False
 695                            m += 1  # next column of the cast profile
 696                        k += 1  # next row of the cast profile
 697            if save_objects:
 698                l_fluo_objects = list(fluo_objects)  # conversion input tuple to the list
 699                if save_only_objects_inside:
 700                    l_fluo_objects = [fluo_obj for fluo_obj in l_fluo_objects if fluo_obj.within_image]
 701                if not rewrite_objects:
 702                    self.fluo_objects += l_fluo_objects  # concatenate 2 lists
 703                else:
 704                    self.fluo_objects = l_fluo_objects[:]  # copy the list
 705
 706    def spread_objects_on(self, fluo_objects: tuple):
 707        """
 708        Compose 2 subsequent methods: self.put_objects_on(self.set_random_places(fluo_objects), save_objects=True).
 709
 710        So, this method puts the provided objects, which are randomly spread on the scene, and saves them in the attribute.
 711
 712        Parameters
 713        ----------
 714        fluo_objects : tuple \n
 715            Fluorescent objects, instances of FluorObj class, packed in a tuple. \n
 716
 717        Returns
 718        -------
 719        None.
 720
 721        """
 722        self.put_objects_on(fluo_objects=self.set_random_places(fluo_objects))
 723
 724    def recreate_scene(self):
 725        """
 726        Recreate the saved objects in the class attribute 'fluo_objects' on the cleared before scene.
 727
 728        Returns
 729        -------
 730        None.
 731
 732        """
 733        if len(self.fluo_objects) > 0 and self.__image_cleared:
 734            self.put_objects_on(fluo_objects=tuple(self.fluo_objects), save_objects=False)
 735        elif not self.__image_cleared:
 736            if len(self.__warn_message) == 0:
 737                self.__warn_message = "The scene is not clear, cannot recreate the scene"
 738                warnings.warn(self.__warn_message)
 739            elif self.__warn_message == "The scene is not clear, cannot recreate the scene":
 740                self.__warn_message = ""
 741        elif len(self.fluo_objects) == 0:
 742            if len(self.__warn_message) == 0:
 743                self.__warn_message = "There are no stored objects within this class instance"
 744                warnings.warn(self.__warn_message)
 745            elif self.__warn_message == "There are no stored objects within this class instance":
 746                self.__warn_message = ""
 747
 748    # %% Scene manipulation
 749    def show_scene(self, str_id: str = "", color_map: str = 'viridis', unique_plot_id: bool = True):
 750        """
 751        Show interactively the stored in the class scene (image) by plotting it using matplotlib.
 752
 753        Parameters
 754        ----------
 755        str_id : str, optional \n
 756            Unique string id for plotting several plots with unique Figure() names. The default is "". \n
 757        color_map: str, optional \n
 758            Color map acceptable by matplotlib.pyplot.cm. Fallback is viridis color map. The default is 'viridis'. \n
 759        unique_plot_id: bool, optional \n
 760            Flag for adding to plot name some random integer id for preventing plots overlapping. The default is True. \n
 761
 762        Returns
 763        -------
 764        None.
 765
 766        """
 767        h, w = self.image.shape; height_width_ratio = h/w; default_image_size = 5.8; additional_id = ""
 768        if len(str_id) == 0:
 769            str_id = str(random.randint(1, 1000))
 770        elif unique_plot_id:
 771            additional_id = str(random.randint(1, 1000))
 772        if not plt.isinteractive():
 773            plt.ion()
 774        if self.__image_cleared:
 775            figure_name = "Blank UscopeScene " + str_id + " " + additional_id
 776        else:
 777            figure_name = "UscopeScene " + str_id + " " + additional_id
 778        plt.figure(figure_name, figsize=(default_image_size, default_image_size*height_width_ratio))
 779        try:
 780            plt.imshow(self.image, cmap=color_map, origin='upper')
 781        except ValueError:
 782            plt.imshow(self.image, cmap=plt.cm.viridis, origin='upper')
 783        plt.axis('off'); plt.tight_layout()
 784
 785    def clear_scene(self):
 786        """
 787        Reinitialize the scene to zero (plain dark background).
 788
 789        Returns
 790        -------
 791        None.
 792
 793        """
 794        if not self.__image_cleared:
 795            self.image = np.zeros(shape=(self.height, self.width), dtype=self.img_type)
 796            self.__binary_placement_mask = None; self.__image_cleared = True
 797
 798    def is_blank(self) -> bool:
 799        """
 800        Returns True, if the scene (image) is blank (zeroed).
 801
 802        Returns
 803        -------
 804        bool \n
 805            Value for designation of a blank scene. \n
 806
 807        """
 808        return self.__image_cleared
 809
 810    # %% Making scene realistic and useful by adding noise: shot and detector ones
 811    def add_noise(self, seed: int = None, mean_noise: Union[int, float] = None, sigma_noise: Union[int, float] = None) -> np.ndarray:
 812        """
 813        Add Poisson (signal dependent shot noise) and background (Gaussian or detector) noise.
 814
 815        Note that if the called again on the scene, this method will add newly generated noise to the initial image.
 816
 817        Parameters
 818        ----------
 819        seed : int, optional \n
 820            Long integer for initializing pseudorandom generator for repeating generated sequences. The default is None. \n
 821        mean_noise : Union[int, float], optional \n
 822            Mean for Gaussian noise intensity. The default is None. \n
 823        sigma_noise : Union[int, float], optional \n
 824            Sigma for Gaussian noise intensity. The default is None. \n
 825
 826        References
 827        ----------
 828        [1] "Imaging in focus: An introduction to denoising bioimages in the era of deep learning", R.F. Laine,
 829        G. Jacquemet, A. Krull (2021) \n
 830        [2] Online Resource: https://bioimagebook.github.io/chapters/3-fluorescence/3-formation_noise/formation_noise.html  \n
 831
 832        Returns
 833        -------
 834        numpy.ndarray \n
 835            The scene added shot (Poisson) and detector (Gaussian) noises. \n
 836
 837        """
 838        if seed is None:
 839            rng = np.random.default_rng()
 840        else:
 841            rng = np.random.default_rng(seed)
 842        if not self.__image_cleared:
 843            # Add the Gaussian noise (background)
 844            if mean_noise is None:
 845                mean_noise = 0.125*np.max(self.image)  # 12.5% of the max value
 846            if sigma_noise is None:
 847                sigma_noise = 0.33*mean_noise  # 33% of the mean
 848            noisy_background = rng.normal(mean_noise, sigma_noise, size=self.image.shape)  # normally distributed noise on background
 849            noisy_background = np.where(noisy_background < 0.0, 0.0, noisy_background)  # check that all pixel values are positive
 850            # Substitute the calculated exact pixel value with the Poisson distributed one due to the properties of commonly used cameras
 851            h, w = self.image.shape; raw_pixels = np.zeros(shape=self.image.shape)
 852            if not self.__noise_added:
 853                self.denoised_image = self.image.copy()  # copy initial scene without noise
 854            else:
 855                self.image = self.denoised_image.copy()  # restore the initial image by the copying the content of the denoised image
 856            # Generate and add noise pixelwise
 857            for i in range(h):
 858                for j in range(w):
 859                    if float(self.image[i, j]) > 0.0:
 860                        raw_pixels[i, j] = rng.poisson(lam=self.image[i, j])  # save converted original value with the Poisson-distributed
 861                        raw_pixels[i, j] += noisy_background[i, j]  # add Gaussian noise
 862                        if raw_pixels[i, j] > self.max_pixel_value:
 863                            raw_pixels[i, j] = self.max_pixel_value  # check that the pixel values are still in range with the image type
 864                    else:
 865                        raw_pixels[i, j] = noisy_background[i, j]
 866            # Casting the noisy image back to the original image format
 867            if self.img_type == 'uint16' or self.img_type is np.uint16 or self.img_type == 'uint8' or self.img_type is np.uint8:
 868                self.image = np.round(raw_pixels, 0).astype(self.img_type)
 869            else:
 870                self.image = raw_pixels.astype(self.img_type)
 871            self.__noise_added = True  # switch the flag for tracking that the noise has been added
 872        return self.image
 873
 874    def remove_noise(self) -> np.ndarray:
 875        """
 876        Remove added previously noise by copying the stored in 'denoise_image' pixel content.
 877
 878        Returns
 879        -------
 880        numpy.ndarray \n
 881            Initial scene without noise. \n
 882
 883        """
 884        if self.__noise_added and self.denoised_image is not None:
 885            self.image = self.denoised_image.copy(); self.__noise_added = False; self.denoised_image = None
 886        return self.image
 887
 888    @staticmethod
 889    def noise2image(image: np.ndarray, seed: int = None, mean_noise: Union[int, float] = None,
 890                    sigma_noise: Union[int, float] = None) -> np.ndarray:
 891        """
 892        Add noise to the image: normal (Gaussian) with mean provided in mean_noise and sigma in sigma_noise parameters and
 893        the Poisson noise afterward.
 894
 895        Parameters
 896        ----------
 897        image : np.ndarray
 898            2D array as an image.
 899        seed : int, optional
 900            Integer used for repeatability of numpy random generation methods. The default is None.
 901        mean_noise : Union[int, float], optional
 902            rng.normal(mean_noise, sigma_noise...) - used in this call. The default is None (mean = 0.125*max(source_image))
 903        sigma_noise : Union[int, float], optional
 904            rng.normal(mean_noise, sigma_noise...) - used in this call. The default is None (sigma = 0.04125*max(source_image)).
 905
 906        Raises
 907        ------
 908        ValueError
 909            Check error signature.
 910
 911        Returns
 912        -------
 913        noisy_image : np.ndarray
 914            With the type as the input image.
 915
 916        """
 917        source_image = np.copy(image)  # to guarantee that input image is not modified
 918        # Initialize random generator using provided seed
 919        if seed is None:
 920            rng = np.random.default_rng()
 921        else:
 922            rng = np.random.default_rng(seed)
 923        # Add the Gaussian noise (background)
 924        if mean_noise is None:
 925            mean_noise = 0.125*np.max(source_image)  # 12.5% of the max value
 926        if sigma_noise is None:
 927            sigma_noise = 0.33*mean_noise  # 33% of the mean
 928        noisy_background = rng.normal(mean_noise, sigma_noise, size=source_image.shape)  # normally distributed noise on background
 929        noisy_background = np.where(noisy_background < 0.0, 0.0, noisy_background)  # check that all pixel values are positive
 930        # Substitute the calculated exact pixel value with the Poisson distributed one due to the properties of commonly used cameras
 931        h, w = source_image.shape; raw_pixels = np.zeros(shape=source_image.shape, dtype=np.float64)
 932        # Define max pixel value
 933        if source_image.dtype == np.uint8:
 934            max_pixel_value = 255
 935        elif source_image.dtype == np.uint16:
 936            max_pixel_value = 2**16 - 1
 937        elif source_image.dtype == np.float64:
 938            max_pixel_value = 1.0
 939        else:
 940            raise ValueError("Supported image types: uint8, uint16 and float64. \n Convert the provided image to these types.")
 941        # Generate and add noise pixelwise, checking the calculated pixel value for consistency with the image type
 942        for i in range(h):
 943            for j in range(w):
 944                if float(source_image[i, j]) > 0.0:
 945                    raw_pixels[i, j] = rng.poisson(lam=source_image[i, j])  # save converted original value with the Poisson-distributed
 946                    raw_pixels[i, j] += noisy_background[i, j]  # add Gaussian noise
 947                    if raw_pixels[i, j] > max_pixel_value:
 948                        raw_pixels[i, j] = max_pixel_value  # check that the pixel values are still in range with the image type
 949                else:
 950                    raw_pixels[i, j] = noisy_background[i, j]
 951        # Casting the noisy image back to the original image format
 952        if source_image.dtype == np.uint8 or source_image.dtype == np.uint16:
 953            noisy_image = np.round(raw_pixels, 0).astype(source_image.dtype)
 954        else:
 955            noisy_image = raw_pixels.astype(source_image.dtype)
 956        return noisy_image
 957
 958    @classmethod
 959    def cast_image(cls, img: np.ndarray, option: str = "neg.norm.") -> Union[np.ndarray, None]:
 960        """
 961        Depending on selected option, output normalized to [-1.0, 1.0] range or rescaled to np.int8 or np.int16 ranges.
 962
 963        Parameters
 964        ----------
 965        img : np.ndarray
 966            Input image as numpy array with real dtype.
 967        option : str
 968            One of the options: 'neg.norm.', 'int8', 'int16', where:\n
 969            'neg.norm.' - output np.float64 image normalized to [-1.0, 1.0]; \n
 970            'int8' - output np.int8 image rescaled to [-127, 127]; \n
 971            'int16' output np.int16 image rescaled to [-32767, 32767]
 972
 973        Returns
 974        -------
 975        np.ndarray or None
 976            Converted image or None if some exception occurs.
 977        """
 978        target = img.copy()  # not operating on an input image as a reference
 979        option = option.replace(" ", "")  # prevent mistakes in typing, like "neg. norm."
 980        if option in cls.__cast_options:
 981            target = target.astype(np.float64)  # universal cast for array manipulations
 982            if option == cls.__cast_options[0]:
 983                if np.min(target) < 0.0:
 984                    # Following logic applied: [-2.0, 0.0, 0.8] -> [-1.0, 0.0, 0.4] - not scaled to [-1.0, 1.0] but normalized to [-1 1]
 985                    if np.abs(np.min(target)) > np.abs(np.max(target)):
 986                        target /= np.abs(np.min(target)); target = np.round(target, 9)
 987                    else:
 988                        target /= np.abs(np.max(target)); target = np.round(target, 9)
 989                    return target
 990                else:
 991                    target -= 0.5*np.max(target)  # shift image from [0.0 ... max] to [-0.5 max, 0.5 max]
 992                    target /= np.max(target); target = np.round(target, 9)  # should normalize target to [-1.0, 1.0]
 993                    # Check that pixel values are within the range
 994                    if np.max(target) > 1.0:
 995                        target /= np.max(target); target = np.round(target, 9)
 996                    if np.min(target) < -1.0:
 997                        target /= np.abs(np.min(target)); target = np.round(target, 9)
 998                    return target
 999            elif option == cls.__cast_options[1]:
1000                norm_neg_target = UscopeScene.cast_image(img)  # get normalized to [-1.0, 1.0] image by default
1001                norm_neg_target *= np.iinfo(np.int8).max  # just use uniform transform to [-127.0, 127.0]
1002                norm_neg_target = np.round(norm_neg_target, 0)  # prepare to conversion to integer values
1003                return norm_neg_target.astype(np.int8)
1004            elif option == cls.__cast_options[2]:
1005                norm_neg_target = UscopeScene.cast_image(img)  # get normalized to [-1.0, 1.0] image by default
1006                norm_neg_target *= np.iinfo(np.int16).max  # just use uniform transform to [-32767.0, 32767.0]
1007                norm_neg_target = np.round(norm_neg_target, 0)  # prepare to conversion to integer values
1008                return norm_neg_target.astype(np.int16)
1009            else:
1010                return None
1011        else:
1012            raise ValueError(f"\nProvided option '{option}' not found among the supported options: {cls.__cast_options}")
1013
1014
1015# %% Object class definition
1016class FluorObj:
1017    """
1018    Modelling the fluorescent bright object with the specified type.
1019
1020    It can be used for embedding it to the 'UscopeScene' class for building up the microscopic image.
1021
1022    """
1023
1024    # Class parameters
1025    shape_type: str = ""; border_type: str = ""; shape_method: str = ""; explicit_shape_name: str = ""
1026    profile: Optional[np.ndarray] = None  # holds an image (profile) of the object
1027    __acceptable_shape_types: list = ['round', 'r', 'ellipse', 'el', 'curved', 'c']  # shape types of the object
1028    __acceptable_border_types: list = ['precise', 'pr', 'computed', 'co']; radius: float = 0.0; a: float = 0.0; b: float = 0.0
1029    typical_sizes: tuple = ()  # for storing descriptive parameters for curve describing the shape of the object
1030    # below - storing names of implemented computing functions for the define continuous shape
1031    __acceptable_shape_methods: list = ['gaussian', 'g', 'lorentzian', 'lor', 'derivative of logistic func.', 'dlogf', 'bump square',
1032                                        'bump2', 'bump cube', 'bump3', 'bump ^8', 'bump8', 'smooth circle', 'smcir', 'oversampled circle',
1033                                        'ovcir', 'undersampled circle', 'uncir', 'circle', 'c']
1034    valuable_round_shapes: list = ['gaussian', 'derivative of logistic func.', 'bump cube', 'bump ^8', 'smooth circle']
1035    image_type = None; center_shifts: tuple = (0.0, 0.0)   # subpixel shift of the center of the object
1036    casted_profile: Optional[np.ndarray] = None  # cast profile to a normalized one for a provided image in a method
1037    __profile_cropped: bool = False  # flag for setting if the profile was cropped (zero pixel rows / columns removed)
1038    external_upper_coordinates: tuple = (0, 0)  # external image coordinates of the upper left pixel
1039    __external_image_sizes: tuple = (0, 0)   # sizes of an external image coordinates of the upper left pixel
1040    within_image: bool = False  # flag for checking that the profile is still within the image
1041
1042    def __init__(self, typical_size: Union[Real, tuple], center_shifts: tuple = (0.0, 0.0), shape_type: str = 'round',
1043                 border_type: str = 'precise', shape_method: str = ''):
1044        f"""
1045        Initialize the class representation of a fluorescent object.
1046
1047        The difference between used parameters can be observed by plotting of the calculated shapes (profiles) by get_shape() method.
1048
1049        Parameters
1050        ----------
1051        typical_size : Union[Real, tuple] \n
1052            Typical sizes of the object, e.g. for a bead - diameter (float or int - Real number in general),
1053            for ellipse - tuple with axes a, b and angle in radians (3 values). \n
1054        center_shifts : tuple, optional \n
1055            Shifts in pixels of the object center, should be less than 1px. The default is (0.0, 0.0). \n
1056        shape_type : str, optional \n
1057            Supported shape types: {self.__acceptable_shape_types}. \n
1058            Currently implemented: 'round' or 'r' - for the circular bead object and 'ellipse' or 'el' - for the ellipse object.
1059            The default is 'round'. \n
1060        border_type : str, optional \n
1061            Type of intensity of the border pixels calculation. Supported border types: 'precise', 'pr', 'computed', 'co'. \n
1062            The 'computed' or 'co' type should be accompanied with the specification of the shape method parameter. \n
1063            The 'precise' or 'pr' type corresponds to the developed counting area of the pixel laying within
1064            the border (e.g., circular) of an object. \n
1065            Note that 'computed' type can be used only for 'round' objects. The default is 'precise'. \n
1066        shape_method : str, optional \n
1067            Shape method calculation, supported ones: {self.__acceptable_shape_methods}. The default is ''. \n
1068
1069        Raises
1070        ------
1071        ValueError \n
1072            See the provided error description for details. \n
1073
1074        Returns
1075        -------
1076        None.
1077
1078        """
1079        # Sanity checks of the input values
1080        if shape_type in self.__acceptable_shape_types:
1081            self.shape_type = shape_type
1082        else:
1083            raise ValueError(f"Provided shape type '{shape_type}' not in acceptable list {self.__acceptable_shape_types}")
1084        if border_type in self.__acceptable_border_types:
1085            self.border_type = border_type
1086        else:
1087            raise ValueError(f"Provided border type '{border_type}' not in acceptable list {self.__acceptable_border_types}")
1088        # Checking typical sizes depending on the shape type
1089        if self.shape_type == "round" or self.shape_type == "r":
1090            typical_size = float(typical_size)  # assuming that the input parameter can be converted to the float type
1091            if typical_size < 1.0:
1092                raise ValueError(f"Expected typical size (radius) should be larger than 1px, provided: {typical_size}")
1093            else:
1094                self.radius = 0.5*typical_size
1095        else:
1096            if self.shape_type == "ellipse" or self.shape_type == "el":
1097                self.border_type = 'precise'  # default border type for ellipse shape calculation
1098                if len(typical_size) != 3:
1099                    raise ValueError("For ellipse particle expected length of typical size tuple is equal 3: (a, b, angle)")
1100                else:
1101                    a, b, angle = typical_size; max_size = max(a, b); min_size = min(a, b)
1102                    if max_size < 1.5 or min_size < 1.0:
1103                        raise ValueError("Expected sizes a, b should be positive, minimal is more than 1px and maximal is more than 1.5px"
1104                                         + f"Provided sizes: {a, b}")
1105                    if angle > 2.0*np.pi or angle < -2.0*np.pi:
1106                        raise ValueError("Expected angle should be in the range of [-2pi, 2pi]")
1107                    self.typical_sizes = typical_size
1108            else:
1109                if len(typical_size) <= 2:
1110                    raise ValueError("For curved particle expected length of typical size tuple is more than 2")
1111                else:
1112                    self.typical_sizes = typical_size
1113            if self.shape_type == "el":
1114                self.explicit_shape_name = 'ellipse'
1115        # Assigning the explicit border type for making full naming for plots
1116        if self.border_type == "computed" or self.border_type == "co":
1117            if shape_method in self.__acceptable_shape_methods:
1118                self.shape_method = shape_method
1119                if self.shape_method == 'g':
1120                    self.explicit_shape_name = 'gaussian'
1121                elif self.shape_method == 'lor':
1122                    self.explicit_shape_name = 'lorentzian'
1123                elif self.shape_method == 'dlogf':
1124                    self.explicit_shape_name = 'derivative of logistic func.'
1125                elif self.shape_method == 'bump2':
1126                    self.explicit_shape_name = 'bump square'
1127                elif self.shape_method == 'bump3':
1128                    self.explicit_shape_name = 'bump cube'
1129                elif self.shape_method == 'bump8':
1130                    self.explicit_shape_name = 'bump ^8'
1131                elif self.shape_method == 'smcir':
1132                    self.explicit_shape_name = 'smooth circle'
1133                elif self.shape_method == 'ovcir':
1134                    self.explicit_shape_name = 'oversampled circle'
1135                elif self.shape_method == 'uncir':
1136                    self.explicit_shape_name = 'undersampled circle'
1137                elif self.shape_method == 'c':
1138                    self.explicit_shape_name = 'circle'
1139            else:
1140                raise ValueError(f"Provided shape comp. method '{shape_method}' not in acceptable list {self.__acceptable_shape_methods}")
1141        # Check that explicit shape name is not empty
1142        if len(self.explicit_shape_name) == 0:
1143            if self.shape_type == "ellipse":
1144                self.explicit_shape_name = self.shape_type[:]
1145            elif self.border_type == "computed" or self.border_type == "co":
1146                self.explicit_shape_name = self.shape_method[:]
1147            elif self.border_type == "precise" or self.border_type == "pr":
1148                self.explicit_shape_name = "round"
1149        # Assuming that center shifts provided as the tuple with x shift, y shift floats in pixels
1150        if len(center_shifts) == 2:
1151            x_shift, y_shift = center_shifts
1152            if abs(x_shift) < 1.0 and abs(y_shift) < 1.0:
1153                self.center_shifts = center_shifts
1154            else:
1155                raise ValueError(f"One of the shifts '{center_shifts}' are more than 1px, but they are expected to be in the subpixel range")
1156
1157    def get_shaping_functions(self) -> str:
1158        """
1159        Print out the implemented methods acceptable for the 'shape_method' parameter.
1160
1161        Returns
1162        -------
1163        str \n
1164            Printed out composed informational string. \n
1165
1166        """
1167        methods = ""; i = 0
1168        while i <= len(self.__acceptable_shape_methods)-1:
1169            methods += "'" + self.__acceptable_shape_methods[i] + "'" + " or " + "'" + self.__acceptable_shape_methods[i+1] + "'" + "\n"
1170            i += 2
1171        info_str = ("The implemented types of continuous bell shape functions or acceptable variables for the 'shape_method' parameter "
1172                    + "(first - the long naming followed by the shortened version): \n" + methods)
1173        print(info_str, flush=True)
1174        return info_str
1175
1176    # %% Calculate and plot shape
1177    def get_shape(self, center_shifts: tuple = None, accelerated: bool = False) -> Union[np.ndarray, None]:
1178        """
1179        Calculate and return 2D intensity normalized (to the range [0.0, 1.0]) distribution of the object shape.
1180
1181
1182        Parameters
1183        ----------
1184        center_shifts : tuple, optional \n
1185            Shifts in pixels of the object center, should be less than 1px. The default is None. \n
1186        accelerated : bool, optional \n
1187            Accelerate the computation by using numba library compilation utilities.
1188            If True, will raise warning if the numba library hasn't been installed in the environment. The default is False. \n
1189
1190        Raises
1191        ------
1192        NotImplementedError \n
1193            For some set of allowed parameters for class initialization the calculation hasn't been yet implemented. \n
1194
1195        References
1196        ----------
1197        Continuously shaped objects are created by adapting the functions from: \n
1198        [1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bell-shaped_function \n
1199        'Precisely' shaped objects are created by the custom algorithm, which calculates part of an object still laying
1200        within the affected ('border') pixels. \n
1201
1202        Returns
1203        -------
1204        2D shape of the object (intensity representation).
1205
1206        """
1207        if center_shifts is not None and len(center_shifts) == 2:
1208            x_shift, y_shift = center_shifts
1209            if abs(x_shift) < 1.0 and abs(y_shift) < 1.0:
1210                self.center_shifts = center_shifts
1211            else:
1212                raise ValueError(f"One of the shifts '{center_shifts}' are more than 1px, "
1213                                 + "but the shifts are expected to be in the subpixel range")
1214        if (self.shape_type == "round" or self.shape_type == "r") and (self.border_type == "computed" or self.border_type == "co"):
1215            self.profile = continuous_shaped_bead(self.radius, self.center_shifts, bead_type=self.shape_method)
1216        elif (self.shape_type == "round" or self.shape_type == "r") and (self.border_type == "precise" or self.border_type == "pr"):
1217            if not accelerated:
1218                self.profile = discrete_shaped_bead(self.radius, self.center_shifts)
1219            elif numba_installed:
1220                self.profile = discrete_shaped_bead_acc(self.radius, self.center_shifts)
1221            else:
1222                if accelerated and not numba_installed:
1223                    __warn_message = "Acceleration isn't possible because 'numba' library not installed in the current environment"
1224                    warnings.warn(__warn_message)
1225                self.profile = discrete_shaped_bead(self.radius, self.center_shifts)
1226        elif self.shape_type == "ellipse" or self.shape_type == "el":
1227            sizes = (self.typical_sizes[0], self.typical_sizes[1]); ellipse_angle = self.typical_sizes[2]
1228            if not accelerated:
1229                self.profile = discrete_shaped_ellipse(sizes, ellipse_angle, self.center_shifts)
1230            elif numba_installed:
1231                self.profile = discrete_shaped_ellipse_acc(sizes, ellipse_angle, self.center_shifts)
1232            else:
1233                if accelerated and not numba_installed:
1234                    __warn_message = "Acceleration isn't possible because 'numba' library not installed in the current environment"
1235                    warnings.warn(__warn_message)
1236                self.profile = discrete_shaped_ellipse(sizes, ellipse_angle, self.center_shifts)
1237        else:
1238            raise NotImplementedError("This set of input parameters hasn't yet been implemented")
1239        self.__profile_cropped = False  # set it to the default value, the profile is uncropped
1240
1241    def get_casted_shape(self, max_pixel_value: Union[int, float],
1242                         image_type: Union[str, np.uint8, np.uint16, np.float64] = 'uint8') -> Union[np.ndarray, None]:
1243        """
1244        Calculate cast from the computed normalized object shape.
1245
1246        Parameters
1247        ----------
1248        max_pixel_value :  Union[int, float] \n
1249            Maximum intensity or pixel value of the object. \n
1250        image_type : Union[str, np.uint8, np.uint16, np.float64], optional \n
1251            Type for casting. The default is 'uint8'. \n
1252
1253        Raises
1254        ------
1255        ValueError \n
1256            If the provided max_pixel_value doesn't correspond to the provided image type. \n
1257
1258        Returns
1259        -------
1260        numpy.ndarray | None (designated as Union) \n
1261            Returns the cast profile or None if the normalized profile hasn't been calculated. \n
1262
1263        """
1264        if image_type not in UscopeScene.acceptable_img_types:
1265            raise ValueError(f"Provided image type '{image_type}' not in the acceptable list of types: "
1266                             + str(UscopeScene.acceptable_img_types))
1267        if self.profile is not None:
1268            if image_type == 'uint8' or image_type is np.uint8:
1269                if max_pixel_value > np.iinfo(np.uint8).max or max_pixel_value < 0:
1270                    raise ValueError(f"Provided max pixel value {max_pixel_value} isn't compatible with a provided image type: {image_type}")
1271                self.image_type = image_type; self.casted_profile = np.round(max_pixel_value * self.profile, 0).astype(np.uint8)
1272                return self.casted_profile
1273            elif image_type == 'uint16' or image_type is np.uint16:
1274                if max_pixel_value > np.iinfo(np.uint16).max or max_pixel_value < 0:
1275                    raise ValueError(f"Provided max pixel value {max_pixel_value} isn't compatible with a provided image type: {image_type}")
1276                self.image_type = image_type; self.casted_profile = np.round(max_pixel_value*self.profile, 0).astype(np.uint16)
1277                return self.casted_profile
1278            elif image_type == 'float' or image_type is np.float64:
1279                self.image_type = image_type; self.casted_profile = max_pixel_value*self.profile
1280                return self.casted_profile
1281            else:
1282                self.casted_profile = None; return self.casted_profile
1283        else:
1284            self.casted_profile = None; return self.casted_profile
1285
1286    def crop_shape(self) -> np.ndarray:
1287        """
1288        Crop zero intensity parts (borders) of the computed profile.
1289
1290        Returns
1291        -------
1292        numpy.ndarray \n
1293            2D cropped profile. \n
1294
1295        """
