1296        if self.profile is not None and not self.__profile_cropped:  # checking that the profile has been calculated and not cropped yet
1297            m, n = self.profile.shape; i_start = 0; j_start = 0; i_end = m; j_end = n; border_found = False
1298            for i in range(m):
1299                if np.max(self.profile[i, :]) > 0.0:
1300                    if not border_found:
1301                        border_found = True
1302                    continue
1303                else:
1304                    if not border_found:
1305                        i_start = i+1
1306                    else:
1307                        i_end = i; break
1308            border_found = False
1309            for j in range(n):
1310                if np.max(self.profile[:, j]) > 0.0:
1311                    if not border_found:
1312                        border_found = True
1313                    continue
1314                else:
1315                    if not border_found:
1316                        j_start = j+1
1317                    else:
1318                        j_end = j; break
1319            self.profile = self.profile[i_start:i_end, j_start:j_end]
1320            if self.casted_profile is not None:
1321                self.casted_profile = self.casted_profile[i_start:i_end, j_start:j_end]
1322            if i_start > 0 or j_start > 0 or i_end < m or j_end < n:
1323                self.__profile_cropped = True
1324        return self.profile
1325
1326    # %% Plotting methods
1327    def plot_shape(self, str_id: str = "", color_map: str = 'viridis'):
1328        """
1329        Plot interactively the profile of the object computed by the get_shape() method along with the border of the object.
1330
1331        Please note that the border will be plotted if the shape hadn't been cropped before.
1332
1333        Parameters
1334        ----------
1335        str_id : str, optional \n
1336            Unique string id for plotting several plots with unique Figure() names. The default is "". \n
1337        color_map : str, optional \n
1338            Color map acceptable by matplotlib.pyplot.cm. Fallback is viridis color map. The default is 'viridis'. \n
1339
1340        Returns
1341        -------
1342        None.
1343
1344        """
1345        if not plt.isinteractive():
1346            plt.ion()
1347        if self.profile is not None:
1348            if self.__profile_cropped:
1349                naming = "Cropped Shape"
1350            else:
1351                naming = "Shape"
1352            if len(str_id) == 0:
1353                str_id = str(random.randint(1, 1000))
1354            plt.figure(f"{naming} with parameters: {self.explicit_shape_name}, {self.border_type}, center: {self.center_shifts} {str_id}")
1355            try:
1356                axes_img = plt.imshow(self.profile, cmap=color_map, origin='upper')
1357            except ValueError:
1358                axes_img = plt.imshow(self.profile, cmap=plt.cm.viridis, origin='upper')
1359            plt.axis('off'); plt.colorbar(); plt.tight_layout()
1360            plot_patch = True  # flag for plotting the patch (Circle or Ellipse)
1361            m_center, n_center = 0.0, 0.0
1362            if not self.__profile_cropped:
1363                m_center, n_center = self.profile.shape  # image sizes
1364                if self.center_shifts[0] < 0.0 and (self.shape_type == "round" or self.shape_type == "r"):
1365                    m_center = m_center // 2 + self.center_shifts[0] + 1.0
1366                elif self.center_shifts[0] >= 0.0:
1367                    m_center = m_center // 2 + self.center_shifts[0]
1368                if self.center_shifts[1] < 0.0 and (self.shape_type == "round" or self.shape_type == "r"):
1369                    n_center = n_center // 2 + self.center_shifts[1] + 1.0
1370                elif self.center_shifts[1] >= 0.0:
1371                    n_center = n_center // 2 + self.center_shifts[1]
1372            else:
1373                plot_patch = False  # just prevent the plotting the patch on the cropped images
1374            if plot_patch:
1375                if self.shape_type == "round" or self.shape_type == "r":
1376                    axes_img.axes.add_patch(Circle((m_center, n_center), self.radius, edgecolor='red', linewidth=1.5, facecolor='none'))
1377                    axes_img.axes.plot(m_center, n_center, marker='.', linewidth=3, color='red')
1378                elif self.shape_type == "ellipse" or self.shape_type == "el":
1379                    axes_img.axes.add_patch(Ellipse((m_center, n_center), self.typical_sizes[0], self.typical_sizes[1],
1380                                                    angle=-self.typical_sizes[2]*180.0/np.pi,
1381                                                    edgecolor='red', facecolor='none', linewidth=1.75))
1382                    axes_img.axes.plot(m_center, n_center, marker='.', linewidth=3, color='red')
1383
1384    def plot_cast_shape(self, str_id: str = ""):
1385        """
1386        Plot interactively the cast to the provided type profile of the object computed by the get_casted_shape() method.
1387
1388        Parameters
1389        ----------
1390        str_id : str, optional \n
1391            Unique string id for plotting several plots with unique Figure() names. The default is "". \n
1392
1393        Returns
1394        -------
1395        None.
1396
1397        """
1398        if not plt.isinteractive():
1399            plt.ion()
1400        if self.casted_profile is not None:
1401            if len(str_id) == 0:
1402                str_id = str(random.randint(1, 1000))
1403            plt.figure(f"Casted shape with parameters: {self.explicit_shape_name}, {self.border_type}, center: {self.center_shifts} {str_id}")
1404            plt.imshow(self.casted_profile, cmap='gray', origin='upper'); plt.axis('off'); plt.colorbar(); plt.tight_layout()
1405
1406    # %% Containing within the image checks
1407    def set_image_sizes(self, image_sizes: tuple):
1408        """
1409        Set containing this object image sizes packed in the tuple.
1410
1411        Parameters
1412        ----------
1413        image_sizes : tuple \n
1414            Expected as (height, width). \n
1415
1416        Raises
1417        ------
1418        ValueError \n
1419            If image sizes provided less than 2 pixels. \n
1420
1421        Returns
1422        -------
1423        None.
1424
1425        """
1426        h, w = image_sizes  # expecting packed height, width - also can be called with image.shape (np.ndarray.shape) attribute
1427        if h > 2 and w > 2:
1428            self.__external_image_sizes = (h, w)
1429        else:
1430            self.__external_image_sizes = (0, 0)  # put the default sizes for always getting False after setting coordinates
1431            raise ValueError("Height and width image is expected to be more than 2 pixels")
1432
1433    def set_coordinates(self, coordinates: tuple) -> bool:
1434        """
1435        Set coordinates of the left upper coordinates of the profile.
1436
1437        Parameters
1438        ----------
1439        coordinates : tuple \n
1440            As i - from rows, j - columns. \n
1441
1442        Returns
1443        -------
1444        bool \n
1445            True if the image containing the profile (even partially). \n
1446
1447        """
1448        # Expecting packed coordinates of the left upper pixel coordinates of a profile
1449        i, j = coordinates; self.external_upper_coordinates = coordinates
1450        if self.profile is not None:
1451            h, w = self.profile.shape; h_image, w_image = self.__external_image_sizes
1452            i_border_check = False; j_border_check = False  # flags for overall checking
1453            # Below - basic check that the profile still is within image, if even its borders still are in
1454            if (i < 0 <= i + h) or (i >= 0 and i - h < h_image):
1455                i_border_check = True
1456            if (j < 0 <= j + w) or (j >= 0 and j - w < w_image):
1457                j_border_check = True
1458            # Additional check that pixels of a shape is still not zero within the image (touching the scene only by border pixels)
1459            if (i < 0 and j < 0) or (i > h_image and j > w_image):
1460                additional_containing_check = False
1461                for i_c in range(i, i+h):
1462                    k = 0
1463                    for j_c in range(j, j+w):
1464                        m = 0
1465                        if 0 <= i_c < h_image and 0 <= j_c < w_image:
1466                            if self.profile[k, m] > 0.0:
1467                                additional_containing_check = True; break
1468                        m += 1
1469                    if additional_containing_check:
1470                        break
1471                    k += 1
1472            else:
1473                additional_containing_check = True
1474            self.within_image = (i_border_check and j_border_check and additional_containing_check)
1475        else:
1476            self.within_image = False  # explicit setting flag
1477        return self.within_image
1478
1479    # %% Rewriting dunder methods for implementing sorting logic
1480    def __lt__(self, other) -> bool:
1481        """
1482        Implementation of '<' comparison operator for letting the default sorting method to work on list of instances.
1483
1484        This method compares only shape sizes multiplication (m, n = self.profile.shape; m*n < other.profile.shape[0]*other.profile.shape[1]).
1485
1486        Parameters
1487        ----------
1488        other : FluorObj \n
1489            Instance of FluorObj() comparison. \n
1490
1491        Returns
1492        -------
1493        bool \n
1494            Result of profile sizes comparison. \n
1495
1496        """
1497        if self.profile is not None and other.profile is not None:
1498            return self.profile.shape[0]*self.profile.shape[1] < other.profile.shape[0]*other.profile.shape[1]
1499        else:
1500            return False
1501
1502    def __eq__(self, other) -> bool:
1503        """
1504        Implementation of '==' comparison operator for letting the default sorting method to work on list of instances.
1505
1506        This method compares shape size (m, n = self.profile.shape; m == other.profile.shape[0] and n == other.profile.shape[1])
1507        and also explicit_shape_name attributes of two classes.
1508
1509        Parameters
1510        ----------
1511        other : FluorObj  \n
1512            Instance of FluorObj() comparison. \n
1513
1514        Returns
1515        -------
1516        bool \n
1517            Result of mentioned above attributes comparison. \n
1518
1519        """
1520        if self.profile is not None and other.profile is not None:
1521            shape_type_check = self.explicit_shape_name == other.explicit_shape_name
1522            shape_sizes_check = (self.profile.shape[0] == other.profile.shape[0] and self.profile.shape[1] == other.profile.shape[1])
1523            return shape_sizes_check and shape_type_check
1524        else:
1525            return False
1526

1543    else:
1544        __warn_message = "Acceleration isn't possible because 'numba' library not installed in the current environment"
1545        warnings.warn(__warn_message)

class UscopeScene: 
  55class UscopeScene:
  56    """
  57    Replicate the common fluorescence microscopic image (frame or 'scene'). \n
  58
  59    This class simulates the bright objects with round and elongate shapes as the basic examples of imaged objects. \n
  60    The ratio behind development of this class - to get the ground truth images for image processing workflows tests. \n
  61    For more complex and useful cases, please, check the References.
  62
  63    References
  64    ----------
  65    In general, there is no references for implementation. For the used noise models, see the 'add_noise method'.
  66
  67    """
  68
  69    # Class parameters
  70    width: int = 4; height: int = 4; __warn_message: str = ""; max_pixel_value: Union[int, float] = 255; img_type = np.uint8
  71    acceptable_img_types: list = ['uint8', 'uint16', 'float', np.uint8, np.uint16, np.float64]
  72    shape: tuple = (height, width); fluo_objects: list = []; shape_types = ['mixed', 'round', 'r', 'ellipse', 'el']
  73    image: Optional[np.ndarray] = None  # now, image can be None as well as np.ndarray after generation
  74    __image_cleared: bool = True  # for tracking that the scene was cleared (zeroed)
  75    __available_coordinates: list = []; __binary_placement_mask: Optional[np.ndarray] = None
  76    denoised_image: Optional[np.ndarray] = None  # keep copy of an initial, free from noise image
  77    __restricted_coordinates: list = []; __noise_added: bool = False  # for tracking that the noise has been added
  78    __round_fl_obj = None; __ellipse_fl_obj = None  # placeholders for classes used for precompilation of methods by numba
  79    __cast_options: list = ["neg.norm.", "int8", "int16"]
  80
  81    def __init__(self, width: int, height: int, image_type: Union[str, np.uint8, np.uint16, np.float64] = 'uint8',
  82                 numba_precompile: bool = True):
  83        """
  84        Initialize the class wrapper for store the current "scene" or microscopic image.
  85
  86        Parameters
  87        ----------
  88        width : int \n
  89            Width of the scene in pixels. \n
  90        height : int \n
  91            Height of the scene in pixels. \n
  92        image_type : str | np.uint8 | np.uint16 | np.float64, optional \n
  93            Image type, for supported ones see the acceptable types. The default is 'uint8'. \n
  94        numba_precompile : bool, optional \n
  95            Flag for precompilation of computing methods using 'numba' library (if it's installed). The default is True.
  96
  97        Raises
  98        ------
  99        ValueError \n
 100            If provided parameters are inconsistent, e.g. width or height < 2. \n
 101
 102        Returns
 103        -------
 104        None.
 105
 106        """
 107        # Check provided width and height
 108        if width < 4 or height < 4:
 109            raise ValueError(f"Provided dimensions ({width}x{height}) is less than 4")
 110        if width > 10000 or height > 10000:
 111            __warn_message = f"Provided dimensions ({width}x{height}) pixels are unrealistic for the common image"
 112            warnings.warn(__warn_message)
 113        self.width = width; self.height = height
 114        # Check an image type
 115        if image_type not in self.acceptable_img_types:
 116            raise ValueError(f"Provided image type '{image_type}' not in the acceptable list of types: " + str(self.acceptable_img_types))
 117        else:
 118            if image_type == 'uint8' or image_type == np.uint8:
 119                self.max_pixel_value = np.iinfo(np.uint8).max; self.img_type = np.uint8
 120            elif image_type == 'uint16' or image_type == np.uint16:
 121                self.max_pixel_value = np.iinfo(np.uint16).max; self.img_type = np.uint16
 122            elif image_type == 'float' or image_type == np.float64:
 123                self.max_pixel_value = 1.0; self.img_type = np.float64
 124        # Initialize zero scene
 125        self.image = np.zeros(shape=(height, width), dtype=self.img_type)
 126        self.__image_cleared = True; self.shape = (self.height, self.width)
 127        self.methods_precompiled = False  # flag for retaining if the objects shape calculation methods precompiled
 128        # Precompile of calculation methods for making calculations more convenient
 129        if numba_precompile and numba_installed:
 130            self.__round_fl_obj = FluorObj(typical_size=2.02, center_shifts=(0.1, -0.2))
 131            self.__ellipse_fl_obj = FluorObj(typical_size=(2.02, 1.52, np.pi / 3.0), center_shifts=(-0.1, 0.2), shape_type='ellipse')
 132            self.precompile_methods()
 133
 134    # %% Objects specification / generation
 135    @classmethod
 136    def get_random_objects(cls, mean_size: Union[Real, tuple], size_std: Union[Real, tuple], intensity_range: tuple,
 137                           n_objects: int = 2, shapes: str = 'round', image_type: Union[str, np.uint8, np.uint16, np.float64] = 'uint8',
 138                           verbose_info: bool = False, accelerated: bool = False) -> tuple:
 139        """
 140        Generate objects with randomized shape sizes, for shape types: 'round', 'ellipse', 'mixed' - last one for randomized choice
 141        between 2 first ones.
 142
 143        Objects should be instances of FluorObj() class from this module.
 144
 145        Parameters
 146        ----------
 147        mean_size : Union[Real, tuple] \n
 148            Mean size(-s) of randomized objects. Integer or float is supposed to be used for round particles, tuple - for ellipse. \n
 149        size_std : Union[Real, tuple] \n
 150            Standard deviation of mean size(-s). \n
 151        intensity_range : tuple \n
 152            (Min, Max) intensities for randomized choice of the maximum intensity along the profile. \n
 153        n_objects : int, optional \n
 154            Number of generated objects. The default is 2. \n
 155        shapes : str, optional \n
 156            Implemented in FluorObj() shapes: 'round', 'ellipse' or 'mixed' them (randomly selected). The default is 'round'. \n
 157        image_type : Union[str, np.uint8, np.uint16, np.float64], optional \n
 158            Image type of the scene on which the objects will be placed and cast to. The default is 'uint8'. \n
 159        verbose_info : bool, optional \n
 160            Flag for printing out verbose information about the generation progress (use it for many objects generation).
 161            The default is False. \n
 162        accelerated : bool, optional \n
 163            Flag for attempting acceleration of objects shape calculation by using 'numba' library compilation. \n
 164
 165        Raises
 166        ------
 167        ValueError  \n
 168            See the provided description in the exception traceback. \n
 169
 170        Returns
 171        -------
 172        tuple
 173            Packed instances of FluorObj() class with the generated objects.
 174
 175        """
 176        if verbose_info:
 177            t_ov_1 = time.perf_counter()
 178        # Check input parameters for consistency
 179        if shapes not in cls.shape_types:
 180            raise ValueError(f"Please provide the supported shape type for generation from a list: {cls.shape_types}")
 181        max_intensity = max(intensity_range); raise_exception = False  # define max provided intensity
 182        if image_type == 'uint8' or image_type == np.uint8:
 183            if max_intensity > np.iinfo(np.uint8).max:
 184                raise_exception = True
 185        elif image_type == 'uint16' or image_type == np.uint16:
 186            if max_intensity > np.iinfo(np.uint16).max:
 187                raise_exception = True
 188        if raise_exception:
 189            raise ValueError(f"Max intensity from the range {intensity_range} is incompatible with the provided image type {image_type}")
 190        fl_objects = []  # for storing generated objects
 191        r = None; r_std = None  # default parameters for round objects
 192        # Printout warning if the method called with parameters leading to the long calculations
 193        if verbose_info and not accelerated:
 194            if np.min(mean_size) >= 4.0 and n_objects >= 10:
 195                print(f"***** Note that the overall generation will take more than ~ {round(1.075*n_objects, 1)} sec. *****", flush=True)
 196        elif verbose_info and accelerated:
 197            if np.min(mean_size) >= 4.0 and n_objects >= 34:
 198                print(f"***** Note that the overall generation will take more than ~ {round(0.3*n_objects, 1)} sec. *****", flush=True)
 199        # Generation loop
 200        for i in range(n_objects):
 201            if verbose_info:
 202                t1 = time.perf_counter()
 203                print(f"Started generation of #{i+1} object", flush=True)
 204            if shapes == 'mixed':
 205                shape_type, r, r_std = get_random_shape_props(mean_size, size_std)
 206            else:
 207                shape_type = shapes
 208            # Random selection of object parameters: shifts, max intensity
 209            i_shift, j_shift = get_random_central_shifts(); fl_intensity = get_random_max_intensity(intensity_range)
 210            # Round shaped object generation
 211            if shape_type == 'round' or shape_type == 'r':
 212                radius = get_radius_gaussian(r, r_std, mean_size, size_std)  # Gaussian-distributed random value
 213                # Generating the object and calculating its shape, cast and crop it
 214                fl_object = FluorObj(typical_size=2.0*radius, center_shifts=(i_shift, j_shift)); fl_object.get_shape(accelerated=accelerated)
 215                fl_object.crop_shape(); fl_object.get_casted_shape(max_pixel_value=fl_intensity, image_type=image_type)
 216                fl_objects.append(fl_object)
 217            # Ellipse shaped object generation
 218            elif shape_type == 'ellipse' or shape_type == 'el':
 219                ellipse_sizes = get_ellipse_sizes(mean_size, size_std)
 220                fl_object = FluorObj(typical_size=ellipse_sizes, center_shifts=(i_shift, j_shift), shape_type='ellipse')
 221                fl_object.get_shape(accelerated=accelerated); fl_object.crop_shape()  # calculate normalized shape and crop it
 222                fl_object.get_casted_shape(max_pixel_value=fl_intensity, image_type=image_type); fl_objects.append(fl_object)
 223            if verbose_info:
 224                print_out_elapsed_t(t1, operation=f"Generation of obj. #{i+1} out of {n_objects}")
 225        if verbose_info:
 226            print_out_elapsed_t(t_ov_1, operation="Overall generation")
 227        return tuple(fl_objects)
 228
 229    def get_objects_acc(self, mean_size: Union[Real, tuple], size_std: Union[Real, tuple], intensity_range: tuple,
 230                        n_objects: int = 2, shapes: str = 'round', image_type: Union[str, np.uint8, np.uint16, np.float64] = 'uint8',
 231                        verbose_info: bool = False) -> tuple:
 232        """
 233        Generate objects with randomized shape sizes, for shape types: 'round', 'ellipse', 'mixed' - last one for randomized choice
 234        between 2 first ones.
 235
 236        This method is accelerated by utilizing the 'numba' library compilation of called inside methods. \n
 237        Objects should be instances of FluorObj() class from this module.
 238
 239        Parameters
 240        ----------
 241        mean_size : Union[Real, tuple]  \n
 242            Mean size(-s) of randomized objects. Integer or float is supposed to be used for round particles, tuple - for ellipse. \n
 243        size_std : Union[Real, tuple]  \n
 244            Standard deviation of mean size(-s). \n
 245        intensity_range : tuple  \n
 246            (Min, Max) intensities for randomized choice of the maximum intensity along the profile.  \n
 247        n_objects : int, optional  \n
 248            Number of generated objects. The default is 2.  \n
 249        shapes : str, optional  \n
 250            Implemented in FluorObj() shapes: 'round', 'ellipse' or 'mixed' them (randomly selected). The default is 'round'.   \n
 251        image_type : Union[str, np.uint8, np.uint16, np.float64], optional  \n
 252            Image type of the scene on which the objects will be placed and cast to. The default is 'uint8'.  \n
 253        verbose_info : bool, optional  \n
 254            Flag for printing out verbose information about the generation progress (use it for many objects generation).
 255            The default is False. \n
 256
 257        Raises
 258        ------
 259        ValueError \n
 260            See the provided description in the exception traceback. \n
 261
 262        Returns
 263        -------
 264        tuple
 265            Packed instances of FluorObj() class with the generated objects.
 266
 267        """
 268        if verbose_info:
 269            t_ov_1 = time.perf_counter()
 270        # Checking input values for consistency
 271        if shapes not in self.shape_types:
 272            raise ValueError(f"Please provide the supported shape type for generation from a list: {self.shape_types}")
 273        if not numba_installed:
 274            raise ValueError("Method can be called if only 'numba' package is installed")
 275        max_intensity = max(intensity_range); raise_exception = False  # define max provided intensity
 276        if image_type == 'uint8' or image_type == np.uint8:
 277            if max_intensity > np.iinfo(np.uint8).max:
 278                raise_exception = True
 279        elif image_type == 'uint16' or image_type == np.uint16:
 280            if max_intensity > np.iinfo(np.uint16).max:
 281                raise_exception = True
 282        if raise_exception:
 283            raise ValueError(f"Max intensity from the range {intensity_range} is incompatible with the provided image type {image_type}")
 284        # Generation parameters
 285        fl_objects = []  # for storing generated objects
 286        r = None; r_std = None  # default parameters for round objects
 287        # Generation loop
 288        for i in range(n_objects):
 289            if verbose_info:
 290                t1 = time.perf_counter()
 291                print(f"Started generation of #{i+1} object", flush=True)
 292            if shapes == 'mixed':
 293                shape_type, r, r_std = get_random_shape_props(mean_size, size_std)
 294            else:
 295                shape_type = shapes
 296            # Random selection of object parameters: shifts, max intensity
 297            i_shift, j_shift = get_random_central_shifts(); fl_intensity = get_random_max_intensity(intensity_range)
 298            # Round shaped object generation
 299            if shape_type == 'round' or shape_type == 'r':
 300                radius = get_radius_gaussian(r, r_std, mean_size, size_std)  # Gaussian-distributed random value
 301                # Generating the object and calculating its shape, cast and crop it
 302                fl_object = FluorObj(typical_size=2.0*radius, center_shifts=(i_shift, j_shift)); fl_object.get_shape(accelerated=True)
 303                fl_object.crop_shape(); fl_object.get_casted_shape(max_pixel_value=fl_intensity, image_type=image_type)
 304                fl_objects.append(fl_object)
 305            # Ellipse shaped object generation
 306            elif (shape_type == 'ellipse' or shape_type == 'el') and isinstance(mean_size, tuple) and isinstance(size_std, tuple):
 307                ellipse_sizes = get_ellipse_sizes(mean_size, size_std)
 308                fl_object = FluorObj(typical_size=ellipse_sizes, center_shifts=(i_shift, j_shift), shape_type='ellipse')
 309                fl_object.get_shape(accelerated=True); fl_object.crop_shape()  # calculate normalized shape and crop it
 310                fl_object.get_casted_shape(max_pixel_value=fl_intensity, image_type=image_type); fl_objects.append(fl_object)
 311            if verbose_info:
 312                print_out_elapsed_t(t1, operation=f"Generation of obj. #{i+1} out of {n_objects}")
 313        if verbose_info:
 314            print_out_elapsed_t(t_ov_1, operation="Overall generation")
 315        return tuple(fl_objects)
 316
 317    def precompile_methods(self, verbose_info: bool = False) -> bool:
 318        """
 319        Precompile computation methods in 'get_random_objects' chain of methods calls.
 320
 321        Parameters
 322        ----------
 323        verbose_info : bool, optional  \n
 324            Flag for more prints out about calculations timing and status. The default is False. \n
 325
 326        Returns
 327        -------
 328        bool  \n
 329            - True, if methods have been precompiled (prerequisite - 'numba' library installed).
 330
 331        """
 332        if not self.methods_precompiled:
 333            if verbose_info:
 334                t_ov_1 = time.perf_counter()
 335            if self.__round_fl_obj is None or self.__ellipse_fl_obj:
 336                self.__round_fl_obj = FluorObj(typical_size=2.02, center_shifts=(0.1, -0.2))
 337                self.__ellipse_fl_obj = FluorObj(typical_size=(2.02, 1.52, np.pi / 3.0), center_shifts=(-0.1, 0.2), shape_type='ellipse')
 338            self.__round_fl_obj.get_shape(accelerated=True); self.__ellipse_fl_obj.get_shape(accelerated=True)
 339            self.methods_precompiled = True
 340            if verbose_info:
 341                print_out_elapsed_t(t_ov_1, "*** Precompilation")
 342        return self.methods_precompiled
 343
 344    @staticmethod
 345    def get_round_objects(mean_size: float, size_std: float, intensity_range: tuple, n_objects: int = 2, shape_r_type: str = 'mixed',
 346                          image_type: Union[str, np.uint8, np.uint16, np.float64] = 'uint8') -> tuple:
 347        """
 348        Generate round shaped objects (as FluorObj class instances) with continuous shapes (see FluorObj class documentation).
 349
 350        Parameters
 351        ----------
 352        mean_size : float  \n
 353            Mean size of objects in pixels.  \n
 354        size_std : float  \n
 355            Standard deviation of objects sizes. \n
 356        intensity_range : tuple \n
 357            Intensity range for selection of maximum object intensity. \n
 358        n_objects : int, optional \n
 359            Number of generated objects. The default is 2. \n
 360        shape_r_type : str, optional \n
 361            Acceptable by FluorObj class round and computed shape types. The default is 'mixed'. \n
 362        image_type : Union[str, np.uint8, np.uint16, np.float64], optional \n
 363            Type of image used for a scene. The default is 'uint8'. \n
 364
 365        Returns
 366        -------
 367        tuple  \n
 368            Generated objects.
 369
 370        """
 371        fl_objects = []; min_intensity, max_intensity = intensity_range
 372        shape_types = FluorObj.valuable_round_shapes[:]; random.shuffle(shape_types)
 373        for i in range(n_objects):
 374            # Random selection of central shifts for placement
 375            i_shift = round(random.random(), 3); j_shift = round(random.random(), 3)  # random generation of central pixel shifts
 376            # Checking that shifts are generated in the subpixel range and correcting it if not
 377            if i_shift >= 1.0:
 378                i_shift -= round(random.random(), 3)*0.25
 379            if j_shift >= 1.0:
 380                j_shift -= round(random.random(), 3)*0.25
 381            radius = abs(random.gauss(mu=mean_size, sigma=size_std))  # get the abs. value of radius from Gaussian distribution
 382            # Random selection of max intensity for the profile casting
 383            if isinstance(min_intensity, int) and isinstance(max_intensity, int):
 384                fl_intensity = random.randrange(min_intensity, max_intensity, 1)
 385            elif isinstance(min_intensity, float) and isinstance(max_intensity, float):
 386                fl_intensity = random.uniform(a=min_intensity, b=max_intensity)
 387            # Checking generated radius for consistency
 388            if radius < 0.5:
 389                radius += random.uniform(a=1.0-radius, b=1.0)
 390            # If mixed type, selecting randomly the shape type
 391            if shape_r_type == 'mixed':
 392                shape_sel_type = random.choice(shape_types)
 393            else:
 394                shape_sel_type = shape_r_type
 395            # Generating the round shaped object with continuous function used for shape calculation
 396            fl_object = FluorObj(typical_size=2.0*radius, center_shifts=(i_shift, j_shift), border_type='co', shape_method=shape_sel_type)
 397            fl_object.get_shape(); fl_object.crop_shape()  # calculate normalized shape and crop it
 398            fl_object.get_casted_shape(max_pixel_value=fl_intensity, image_type=image_type); fl_objects.append(fl_object)
 399        return tuple(fl_objects)
 400
 401    # %% Randomly assigning coordinates for objects
 402    def set_random_places(self, fluo_objects: tuple = (), overlapping: bool = True, touching: bool = True,
 403                          only_within_scene: bool = False, verbose_info: bool = False) -> tuple:
 404        """
 405        Set random coordinates within scene (or partially outside) for provided objects.
 406
 407        Parameters
 408        ----------
 409        fluo_objects : tuple, optional \n
 410            Tuple with generated instances of FluorObj() class. The default is (). \n
 411        overlapping : bool, optional \n
 412            If True, the coordinates will be randomly selected from available ones. \n
 413            If False, the largest object will be placed firstly, and others will be placed after with checking that the object to be placed
 414            are not intersected with the already placed objects on previous iterations.  \n
 415            The default is True. \n
 416        touching : bool, optional \n
 417            Flag for allowing objects to touch by their border pixels. Note that if overlapping is True, this flag ignored.
 418            The default is True. \n
 419        only_within_scene : bool, optional
 420            If True, the objects will be placed completely within (inside) the scene. \n
 421            If False, objects may lay partially outside the scene. The default is False. \n
 422        verbose_info : bool, optional \n
 423            Printing out verbose information about performance of placement. The default is False. \n
 424
 425        Returns
 426        -------
 427        tuple
 428            With the placed objects.
 429
 430        """
 431        if len(fluo_objects) > 0:
 432            # For making verbose information printouts, check the time performance of placement logic
 433            if verbose_info:
 434                t1 = time.perf_counter()
 435            h, w = self.image.shape  # height and width of the image for setting the range of coordinates random selection
 436            if not overlapping:
 437                filtered_fluo_obj = []  # storing the objects in the list for excluding the not placed objects if they are not overlapped
 438                additional_border = 0
 439                if not touching:
 440                    additional_border = 1  # additional 1 pixel for excluding the pixels close to the object borders
 441            # If only_within_scene, sort out the objects based on their sizes and place first the largest one, if not - the smallest one
 442            if not overlapping or (overlapping and only_within_scene):
 443                fluo_objects = list(fluo_objects)  # convert for applying embedded sorting algorithm
 444            if only_within_scene:
 445                fluo_objects.sort(reverse=True)
 446            elif not overlapping and not only_within_scene:
 447                fluo_objects.sort()
 448            # Printing out the warning messages (obtained for some useful cases and flags)
 449            if len(fluo_objects) > 1 and verbose_info and fluo_objects[0].profile is not None:
 450                h_fl_obj, w_fl_obj = fluo_objects[0].profile.shape  # get the largest object sizes
 451                if len(fluo_objects) >= 5 or (h_fl_obj > 10 and w_fl_obj > 10):
 452                    if not numba_installed:
 453                        print("NOTE: Placing algorithm can take quite a long time (depending on the size of objects and scene). \n"
 454                              + "For acceleration of it install library 'numba' with the recommended version >= 0.57.1", flush=True)
 455                    print(f"***** Placing of {len(fluo_objects)} objects started *****", flush=True)
 456            if verbose_info and not overlapping:
 457                if not numba_installed:
 458                    if h*w > 35000:
 459                        print("Note that placing algorithm can take long time, starting from several dozens of seconds", flush=True)
 460                else:
 461                    if h*w > 110000:
 462                        print("Note that placing algorithm can take long time, starting from several dozens of seconds", flush=True)
 463            # Placing loop for provided objects (set random placing coordinates of the upper left pixel for the objects)
 464            placed_objects = 0  # for printing out the number of placed objects
 465            for fluo_obj in fluo_objects:
 466                if fluo_obj.profile is not None:
 467                    if verbose_info:
 468                        t_obj = time.perf_counter(); print(f"Started placing of #{placed_objects+1} object", flush=True)
 469                    h_fl_obj, w_fl_obj = fluo_obj.profile.shape  # get object sizes
 470                    fluo_obj.set_image_sizes(self.image.shape)  # force to account for the used scene shape
 471                    # Placement logic, if overlapping is allowed - just random spreading objects on the scene
 472                    if overlapping or (not overlapping and self.__binary_placement_mask is None):
 473                        # Depending on the flag, defining smallest and largest coordinates (outside the scene borders or only inside)
 474                        if only_within_scene:
 475                            i_smallest = 1; j_smallest = 1; i_largest = h-h_fl_obj-1; j_largest = w-w_fl_obj-1
 476                        else:
 477                            # smallest placing coordinate = half of object sizes - 1 pixel, analogous for largest coordinates
 478                            i_smallest = -(h_fl_obj // 2) + 1; j_smallest = -(w_fl_obj // 2) + 1
 479                            i_largest = (h - h_fl_obj // 2) - 2; j_largest = (w - w_fl_obj // 2) - 2
 480                        # Random selection of i, j coordinates below
 481                        i_obj = random.randrange(i_smallest, i_largest, 1); j_obj = random.randrange(j_smallest, j_largest, 1)
 482                        # Not overlapping, below - place the largest object and create the mask for preventing the overlapping
 483                        if not overlapping:
 484                            # Generate the meshgrid of all available for placing coordinates (depending on the placement flag)
 485                            if not only_within_scene and len(fluo_objects) > 1:
 486                                if not numba_installed:
 487                                    self.__available_coordinates = [(i_a, j_a) for i_a in range(i_smallest, i_largest)
 488                                                                    for j_a in range(j_smallest, j_largest)]
 489                                else:
 490                                    generate_coordinates_list(1, 3, 1, 3)  # precompile method for acceleration further calls
 491                                    self.__available_coordinates = generate_coordinates_list(i_smallest, i_largest, j_smallest, j_largest)
 492                            else:
 493                                # Below - keep the possible placement close to bottom and right edges of the scene and remove them later
 494                                if not numba_installed:
 495                                    self.__available_coordinates = [(i_a, j_a) for i_a in range(i_smallest, h-2)
 496                                                                    for j_a in range(j_smallest, w-2)]
 497                                    self.__restricted_coordinates = [(i_a, j_a) for i_a in range(i_smallest, i_largest)
 498                                                                     for j_a in range(j_smallest, j_largest)]
 499                                else:
 500                                    generate_coordinates_list(1, 3, 1, 3)  # precompile method for acceleration further calls
 501                                    self.__available_coordinates = generate_coordinates_list(i_smallest, h-2, j_smallest, w-2)
 502                                    self.__restricted_coordinates = generate_coordinates_list(i_smallest, i_largest, j_smallest, j_largest)
 503                            # Generate the binary mask (instead of the real image or scene) for placing more than 1 object
 504                            if len(fluo_objects) > 1:
 505                                self.__binary_placement_mask = np.zeros(shape=self.image.shape, dtype='uint8')
 506                                if not numba_installed:
 507                                    self.__binary_placement_mask = set_binary_mask_coords_in_loop(self.__binary_placement_mask,
 508                                                                                                  i_obj-additional_border,
 509                                                                                                  i_obj+h_fl_obj+additional_border,
 510                                                                                                  self.image.shape[0],
 511                                                                                                  j_obj-additional_border,
 512                                                                                                  j_obj+w_fl_obj+additional_border,
 513                                                                                                  self.image.shape[1])
 514                                else:
 515                                    set_binary_mask_coordinates(np.zeros((2, 2)), 0, 1, 2, 0, 1, 2)  # precompilation
 516                                    self.__binary_placement_mask = set_binary_mask_coordinates(self.__binary_placement_mask,
 517                                                                                               i_obj-additional_border,
 518                                                                                               i_obj+h_fl_obj+additional_border,
 519                                                                                               self.image.shape[0],
 520                                                                                               j_obj-additional_border,
 521                                                                                               j_obj+w_fl_obj+additional_border,
 522                                                                                               self.image.shape[1])
 523                                # Exclude the coordinates occupied by the placed object from the available choices for further placements
 524                                if not numba_installed:
 525                                    coordinates_for_del = [(i_exc, j_exc)
 526                                                           for i_exc in range(i_obj-additional_border, i_obj+h_fl_obj+additional_border)
 527                                                           for j_exc in range(j_obj-additional_border, j_obj+w_fl_obj+additional_border)]
 528                                else:
 529                                    coordinates_for_del = generate_coordinates_list(i_obj-additional_border, i_obj+h_fl_obj+additional_border,
 530                                                                                    j_obj-additional_border, j_obj+w_fl_obj+additional_border)
 531                                self.__available_coordinates = delete_coordinates_from_list(coordinates_for_del,
 532                                                                                            self.__available_coordinates)
 533                            filtered_fluo_obj.append(fluo_obj)  # storing the 1st placed and not overlapped objects
 534                            random.shuffle(self.__available_coordinates)  # shuffle available coordinates
 535                        fluo_obj.set_coordinates((i_obj, j_obj)); placed_objects += 1  # set random place of the object within the image
 536                        if verbose_info:
 537                            print("# of placed objects:", placed_objects, "out of", len(fluo_objects), flush=True)
 538                            print_out_elapsed_t(t_obj, operation="Placing 1st object")
 539                    else:
 540                        # Trying to place the object in the randomly selected from remaining coordinates place and checking if there is no
 541                        # intersections with already placed objects, regulate # of attempts to place below in the while condition
 542                        if verbose_info:
 543                            t_obj = time.perf_counter()
 544                        i_attempts = 0; placed = False; available_correcting_coordinates = self.__available_coordinates[:]
 545                        # Adapting max number of attempts
 546                        if 0 < len(available_correcting_coordinates) < 50:
 547                            max_attempts = len(available_correcting_coordinates)
 548                        else:
 549                            max_attempts = 50  # limiting max number of attempts to find suitable coordinates
 550                        # Trying to place the object and check for intersections with the other ones
 551                        border_coordinates_deleted = False
 552                        while (not placed and i_attempts < max_attempts) and len(available_correcting_coordinates) > 0:
 553                            overlapped = False  # flag for checking if the object is overlapped with the occupied place on a binary mask
 554                            # randomly choose from the available coordinates
 555                            if not only_within_scene:
 556                                i_obj, j_obj = random.choice(available_correcting_coordinates)
 557                            else:
 558                                if not border_coordinates_deleted:
 559                                    i_obj, j_obj = random.choice(self.__restricted_coordinates)
 560                                else:
 561                                    i_obj, j_obj = random.choice(available_correcting_coordinates)
 562                            # Vectorized form of the overlapping check
 563                            i_max, j_max = self.__binary_placement_mask.shape; i_max -= 1; j_max -= 1
 564                            # Define the region of the placement mask for checking
 565                            if i_obj-additional_border < 0:
 566                                i_start = 0
 567                            else:
 568                                i_start = i_obj - additional_border
 569                            if j_obj-additional_border < 0:
 570                                j_start = 0
 571                            else:
 572                                j_start = j_obj - additional_border
 573                            if i_obj + h_fl_obj + additional_border > i_max:
 574                                i_finish = i_max
 575                            else:
 576                                i_finish = i_obj + h_fl_obj + additional_border
 577                            if j_obj + w_fl_obj + additional_border > j_max:
 578                                j_finish = j_max
 579                            else:
 580                                j_finish = j_obj + w_fl_obj + additional_border
 581                            if np.max(self.__binary_placement_mask[i_start:i_finish, j_start:j_finish]) > 0:
 582                                overlapped = True; placed = False; i_attempts += 1
 583                                try:
 584                                    available_correcting_coordinates.remove((i_obj, j_obj))
 585                                    self.__available_coordinates.remove((i_obj, j_obj))
 586                                except ValueError:
 587                                    pass
 588                            # Check that object placed and if not, delete border pixels for placing (long-lasting function)
 589                            if not overlapped:
 590                                placed = True; break
 591                            else:
 592                                # Prevent placing out of scene by removing from available coordinates
 593                                if only_within_scene:
 594                                    if not numba_installed:
 595                                        coordinates_for_del = [(i_exc, j_exc) for i_exc in range(h-h_fl_obj, h-2) for j_exc in range(1, w-2)]
 596                                        coordinates_for_del += [(i_exc, j_exc) for i_exc in range(1, h-2) for j_exc in range(w-w_fl_obj, w-2)]
 597                                    else:
 598                                        coordinates_for_del = generate_coordinates_list(h-h_fl_obj, h-2, 1, w-2)
 599                                        coordinates_for_del += generate_coordinates_list(1, h-2, w-w_fl_obj, w-2)
 600                                    available_correcting_coordinates = delete_coordinates_from_list(coordinates_for_del,
 601                                                                                                    available_correcting_coordinates)
 602                                    border_coordinates_deleted = True
 603                            if len(available_correcting_coordinates) == 0:
 604                                placed = False; break
 605                        # Exclude the coordinates occupied by the placed object from the meshgrid (list with coordinates pares)
 606                        if placed:
 607                            if not numba_installed:
 608                                coordinates_for_del = [(i_exc, j_exc)
 609                                                       for i_exc in range(i_obj-additional_border, i_obj+h_fl_obj+additional_border)
 610                                                       for j_exc in range(j_obj-additional_border, j_obj+w_fl_obj+additional_border)]
 611                            else:
 612                                coordinates_for_del = generate_coordinates_list(i_obj-additional_border, i_obj+h_fl_obj+additional_border,
 613                                                                                j_obj-additional_border, j_obj+w_fl_obj+additional_border)
 614                            for del_coord in coordinates_for_del:
 615                                try:
 616                                    self.__available_coordinates.remove(del_coord)
 617                                    if only_within_scene:
 618                                        self.__restricted_coordinates.remove(del_coord)
 619                                except ValueError:
 620                                    pass
 621                            # Exclude placed object from binary placement mask
 622                            if not numba_installed:
 623                                self.__binary_placement_mask = set_binary_mask_coords_in_loop(self.__binary_placement_mask,
 624                                                                                              i_obj, i_obj+h_fl_obj,
 625                                                                                              self.image.shape[0],
 626                                                                                              j_obj, j_obj+w_fl_obj,
 627                                                                                              self.image.shape[1])
 628                            else:
 629                                self.__binary_placement_mask = set_binary_mask_coordinates(self.__binary_placement_mask,
 630                                                                                           i_obj, i_obj+h_fl_obj,
 631                                                                                           self.image.shape[0],
 632                                                                                           j_obj, j_obj+w_fl_obj,
 633                                                                                           self.image.shape[1])
 634                            fluo_obj.set_coordinates((i_obj, j_obj))  # if found place, place the object
 635                            filtered_fluo_obj.append(fluo_obj); placed_objects += 1  # collect for returning only placed objects
 636                            if verbose_info:
 637                                print("# of placed objects:", placed_objects, "out of", len(fluo_objects), flush=True)
 638                                print_out_elapsed_t(t_obj, operation=f"Placing #{placed_objects} object")
 639            if not overlapping:
 640                fluo_objects = tuple(filtered_fluo_obj)  # convert list -> tuple for returning only placed objects
 641                # plt.figure("Binary Placement Mask"); plt.imshow(self.__binary_placement_mask)  # plot the occupied places by the objects
 642            if verbose_info:
 643                print_out_elapsed_t(t1, operation=f"Placing of {placed_objects} objects")
 644        return fluo_objects
 645
 646    # %% Put objects on the scene
 647    def put_objects_on(self, fluo_objects: tuple = (), save_objects: bool = True, save_only_objects_inside: bool = False,
 648                       rewrite_objects: bool = False):
 649        """
 650        Put the provided objects on the scene by checking pixelwise the provided profiles and in the case of intersection of
 651        two objects profiles, selecting the maximum intensity from them.
 652
 653        Parameters
 654        ----------
 655        fluo_objects : tuple, optional  \n
 656            Fluorescent objects, instances of FluorObj class, packed in a tuple. The default is (). \n
 657        save_objects : bool, optional \n
 658            If True, will save (append) objects in the class attribute 'fluo_objects'. The default is True. \n
 659            Note that, if it's False, then before placing the objects, the scene will be cleared
 660            (stored before objects will be removed from it). \n
 661        save_only_objects_inside : bool, optional \n
 662            Save in the class attribute ('fluo_objects') only objects that are inside the image. The default is False. \n
 663        rewrite_objects : bool, optional \n
 664            If True, it forces to substitute stored objects in the class attribute 'fluo_objects' with the provided ones.
 665            The default is False. \n
 666
 667        Returns
 668        -------
 669        None.
 670
 671        """
 672        if len(fluo_objects) > 0:
 673            if len(self.fluo_objects) == 0 or not save_objects:
 674                self.clear_scene()  # clear the scene before placing the objects only if there are no saved objects and the flag is False
 675            for fluo_obj in fluo_objects:
 676                if fluo_obj.within_image and fluo_obj.casted_profile is not None and self.image is not None:
 677                    i_start, j_start = fluo_obj.external_upper_coordinates; i_size, j_size = fluo_obj.casted_profile.shape
 678                    h, w = self.image.shape  # for checking that the placing happening within the image
 679                    k = 0  # for counting on the profile
 680                    for i in range(i_start, i_start+i_size):
 681                        m = 0  # refresh starting column for counting on the object profile
 682                        for j in range(j_start, j_start+j_size):
 683                            if 0 <= i < h and 0 <= j < w:
 684                                if self.img_type == np.uint8 or self.img_type == np.uint16:
 685                                    if self.image[i, j] == 0:
 686                                        self.image[i, j] = fluo_obj.casted_profile[k, m]
 687                                    else:
 688                                        self.image[i, j] = max(self.image[i, j], fluo_obj.casted_profile[k, m])
 689                                else:  # float image type
 690                                    if self.image[i, j] < 1E-9:
 691                                        self.image[i, j] = fluo_obj.casted_profile[k, m]
 692                                    else:
 693                                        self.image[i, j] = max(self.image[i, j], fluo_obj.casted_profile[k, m])
 694                                if self.__image_cleared:
 695                                    self.__image_cleared = False
 696                            m += 1  # next column of the cast profile
 697                        k += 1  # next row of the cast profile
 698            if save_objects:
 699                l_fluo_objects = list(fluo_objects)  # conversion input tuple to the list
 700                if save_only_objects_inside:
 701                    l_fluo_objects = [fluo_obj for fluo_obj in l_fluo_objects if fluo_obj.within_image]
 702                if not rewrite_objects:
 703                    self.fluo_objects += l_fluo_objects  # concatenate 2 lists
 704                else:
 705                    self.fluo_objects = l_fluo_objects[:]  # copy the list
 706
 707    def spread_objects_on(self, fluo_objects: tuple):
 708        """
 709        Compose 2 subsequent methods: self.put_objects_on(self.set_random_places(fluo_objects), save_objects=True).
 710
 711        So, this method puts the provided objects, which are randomly spread on the scene, and saves them in the attribute.
 712
 713        Parameters
 714        ----------
 715        fluo_objects : tuple \n
 716            Fluorescent objects, instances of FluorObj class, packed in a tuple. \n
 717
 718        Returns
 719        -------
 720        None.
 721
 722        """
 723        self.put_objects_on(fluo_objects=self.set_random_places(fluo_objects))
 724
 725    def recreate_scene(self):
 726        """
 727        Recreate the saved objects in the class attribute 'fluo_objects' on the cleared before scene.
 728
 729        Returns
 730        -------
 731        None.
 732
 733        """
 734        if len(self.fluo_objects) > 0 and self.__image_cleared:
 735            self.put_objects_on(fluo_objects=tuple(self.fluo_objects), save_objects=False)
 736        elif not self.__image_cleared:
 737            if len(self.__warn_message) == 0:
 738                self.__warn_message = "The scene is not clear, cannot recreate the scene"
 739                warnings.warn(self.__warn_message)
 740            elif self.__warn_message == "The scene is not clear, cannot recreate the scene":
 741                self.__warn_message = ""
 742        elif len(self.fluo_objects) == 0:
 743            if len(self.__warn_message) == 0:
 744                self.__warn_message = "There are no stored objects within this class instance"
 745                warnings.warn(self.__warn_message)
 746            elif self.__warn_message == "There are no stored objects within this class instance":
 747                self.__warn_message = ""
 748
 749    # %% Scene manipulation
 750    def show_scene(self, str_id: str = "", color_map: str = 'viridis', unique_plot_id: bool = True):
 751        """
 752        Show interactively the stored in the class scene (image) by plotting it using matplotlib.
 753
 754        Parameters
 755        ----------
 756        str_id : str, optional \n
 757            Unique string id for plotting several plots with unique Figure() names. The default is "". \n
 758        color_map: str, optional \n
 759            Color map acceptable by matplotlib.pyplot.cm. Fallback is viridis color map. The default is 'viridis'. \n
 760        unique_plot_id: bool, optional \n
 761            Flag for adding to plot name some random integer id for preventing plots overlapping. The default is True. \n
 762
 763        Returns
 764        -------
 765        None.
 766
 767        """
 768        h, w = self.image.shape; height_width_ratio = h/w; default_image_size = 5.8; additional_id = ""
 769        if len(str_id) == 0:
 770            str_id = str(random.randint(1, 1000))
 771        elif unique_plot_id:
 772            additional_id = str(random.randint(1, 1000))
 773        if not plt.isinteractive():
 774            plt.ion()
 775        if self.__image_cleared:
 776            figure_name = "Blank UscopeScene " + str_id + " " + additional_id
 777        else:
 778            figure_name = "UscopeScene " + str_id + " " + additional_id
 779        plt.figure(figure_name, figsize=(default_image_size, default_image_size*height_width_ratio))
 780        try:
 781            plt.imshow(self.image, cmap=color_map, origin='upper')
 782        except ValueError:
 783            plt.imshow(self.image, cmap=plt.cm.viridis, origin='upper')
 784        plt.axis('off'); plt.tight_layout()
 785
 786    def clear_scene(self):
 787        """
 788        Reinitialize the scene to zero (plain dark background).
 789
 790        Returns
 791        -------
 792        None.
 793
 794        """
 795        if not self.__image_cleared:
 796            self.image = np.zeros(shape=(self.height, self.width), dtype=self.img_type)
 797            self.__binary_placement_mask = None; self.__image_cleared = True
 798
 799    def is_blank(self) -> bool:
 800        """
 801        Returns True, if the scene (image) is blank (zeroed).
 802
 803        Returns
 804        -------
 805        bool \n
 806            Value for designation of a blank scene. \n
 807
 808        """
 809        return self.__image_cleared
 810
 811    # %% Making scene realistic and useful by adding noise: shot and detector ones
 812    def add_noise(self, seed: int = None, mean_noise: Union[int, float] = None, sigma_noise: Union[int, float] = None) -> np.ndarray:
 813        """
 814        Add Poisson (signal dependent shot noise) and background (Gaussian or detector) noise.
 815
 816        Note that if the called again on the scene, this method will add newly generated noise to the initial image.
 817
 818        Parameters
 819        ----------
 820        seed : int, optional \n
 821            Long integer for initializing pseudorandom generator for repeating generated sequences. The default is None. \n
 822        mean_noise : Union[int, float], optional \n
 823            Mean for Gaussian noise intensity. The default is None. \n
 824        sigma_noise : Union[int, float], optional \n
 825            Sigma for Gaussian noise intensity. The default is None. \n
 826
 827        References
 828        ----------
 829        [1] "Imaging in focus: An introduction to denoising bioimages in the era of deep learning", R.F. Laine,
 830        G. Jacquemet, A. Krull (2021) \n
 831        [2] Online Resource: https://bioimagebook.github.io/chapters/3-fluorescence/3-formation_noise/formation_noise.html  \n
 832
 833        Returns
 834        -------
 835        numpy.ndarray \n
 836            The scene added shot (Poisson) and detector (Gaussian) noises. \n
 837
 838        """
 839        if seed is None:
 840            rng = np.random.default_rng()
 841        else:
 842            rng = np.random.default_rng(seed)
 843        if not self.__image_cleared:
 844            # Add the Gaussian noise (background)
 845            if mean_noise is None:
 846                mean_noise = 0.125*np.max(self.image)  # 12.5% of the max value
 847            if sigma_noise is None:
 848                sigma_noise = 0.33*mean_noise  # 33% of the mean
 849            noisy_background = rng.normal(mean_noise, sigma_noise, size=self.image.shape)  # normally distributed noise on background
 850            noisy_background = np.where(noisy_background < 0.0, 0.0, noisy_background)  # check that all pixel values are positive
 851            # Substitute the calculated exact pixel value with the Poisson distributed one due to the properties of commonly used cameras
 852            h, w = self.image.shape; raw_pixels = np.zeros(shape=self.image.shape)
 853            if not self.__noise_added:
 854                self.denoised_image = self.image.copy()  # copy initial scene without noise
 855            else:
 856                self.image = self.denoised_image.copy()  # restore the initial image by the copying the content of the denoised image
 857            # Generate and add noise pixelwise
 858            for i in range(h):
 859                for j in range(w):
 860                    if float(self.image[i, j]) > 0.0:
 861                        raw_pixels[i, j] = rng.poisson(lam=self.image[i, j])  # save converted original value with the Poisson-distributed
 862                        raw_pixels[i, j] += noisy_background[i, j]  # add Gaussian noise
 863                        if raw_pixels[i, j] > self.max_pixel_value:
 864                            raw_pixels[i, j] = self.max_pixel_value  # check that the pixel values are still in range with the image type
 865                    else:
 866                        raw_pixels[i, j] = noisy_background[i, j]
 867            # Casting the noisy image back to the original image format
 868            if self.img_type == 'uint16' or self.img_type is np.uint16 or self.img_type == 'uint8' or self.img_type is np.uint8:
 869                self.image = np.round(raw_pixels, 0).astype(self.img_type)
 870            else:
 871                self.image = raw_pixels.astype(self.img_type)
 872            self.__noise_added = True  # switch the flag for tracking that the noise has been added
 873        return self.image
 874
 875    def remove_noise(self) -> np.ndarray:
 876        """
 877        Remove added previously noise by copying the stored in 'denoise_image' pixel content.
 878
 879        Returns
 880        -------
 881        numpy.ndarray \n
 882            Initial scene without noise. \n
 883
 884        """
 885        if self.__noise_added and self.denoised_image is not None:
 886            self.image = self.denoised_image.copy(); self.__noise_added = False; self.denoised_image = None
 887        return self.image
 888
 889    @staticmethod
 890    def noise2image(image: np.ndarray, seed: int = None, mean_noise: Union[int, float] = None,
 891                    sigma_noise: Union[int, float] = None) -> np.ndarray:
 892        """
 893        Add noise to the image: normal (Gaussian) with mean provided in mean_noise and sigma in sigma_noise parameters and
 894        the Poisson noise afterward.
 895
 896        Parameters
 897        ----------
 898        image : np.ndarray
 899            2D array as an image.
 900        seed : int, optional
 901            Integer used for repeatability of numpy random generation methods. The default is None.
 902        mean_noise : Union[int, float], optional
 903            rng.normal(mean_noise, sigma_noise...) - used in this call. The default is None (mean = 0.125*max(source_image))
 904        sigma_noise : Union[int, float], optional
 905            rng.normal(mean_noise, sigma_noise...) - used in this call. The default is None (sigma = 0.04125*max(source_image)).
 906
 907        Raises
 908        ------
 909        ValueError
 910            Check error signature.
 911
 912        Returns
 913        -------
 914        noisy_image : np.ndarray
 915            With the type as the input image.
 916
 917        """
 918        source_image = np.copy(image)  # to guarantee that input image is not modified
 919        # Initialize random generator using provided seed
 920        if seed is None:
 921            rng = np.random.default_rng()
 922        else:
 923            rng = np.random.default_rng(seed)
 924        # Add the Gaussian noise (background)
 925        if mean_noise is None:
 926            mean_noise = 0.125*np.max(source_image)  # 12.5% of the max value
 927        if sigma_noise is None:
 928            sigma_noise = 0.33*mean_noise  # 33% of the mean
 929        noisy_background = rng.normal(mean_noise, sigma_noise, size=source_image.shape)  # normally distributed noise on background
 930        noisy_background = np.where(noisy_background < 0.0, 0.0, noisy_background)  # check that all pixel values are positive
 931        # Substitute the calculated exact pixel value with the Poisson distributed one due to the properties of commonly used cameras
 932        h, w = source_image.shape; raw_pixels = np.zeros(shape=source_image.shape, dtype=np.float64)
 933        # Define max pixel value
 934        if source_image.dtype == np.uint8:
 935            max_pixel_value = 255
 936        elif source_image.dtype == np.uint16:
 937            max_pixel_value = 2**16 - 1
 938        elif source_image.dtype == np.float64:
 939            max_pixel_value = 1.0
 940        else:
 941            raise ValueError("Supported image types: uint8, uint16 and float64. \n Convert the provided image to these types.")
 942        # Generate and add noise pixelwise, checking the calculated pixel value for consistency with the image type
 943        for i in range(h):
 944            for j in range(w):
 945                if float(source_image[i, j]) > 0.0:
 946                    raw_pixels[i, j] = rng.poisson(lam=source_image[i, j])  # save converted original value with the Poisson-distributed
 947                    raw_pixels[i, j] += noisy_background[i, j]  # add Gaussian noise
 948                    if raw_pixels[i, j] > max_pixel_value:
 949                        raw_pixels[i, j] = max_pixel_value  # check that the pixel values are still in range with the image type
 950                else:
 951                    raw_pixels[i, j] = noisy_background[i, j]
 952        # Casting the noisy image back to the original image format
 953        if source_image.dtype == np.uint8 or source_image.dtype == np.uint16:
 954            noisy_image = np.round(raw_pixels, 0).astype(source_image.dtype)
 955        else:
 956            noisy_image = raw_pixels.astype(source_image.dtype)
 957        return noisy_image
 958
 959    @classmethod
 960    def cast_image(cls, img: np.ndarray, option: str = "neg.norm.") -> Union[np.ndarray, None]:
 961        """
 962        Depending on selected option, output normalized to [-1.0, 1.0] range or rescaled to np.int8 or np.int16 ranges.
 963
 964        Parameters
 965        ----------
 966        img : np.ndarray
 967            Input image as numpy array with real dtype.
 968        option : str
 969            One of the options: 'neg.norm.', 'int8', 'int16', where:\n
 970            'neg.norm.' - output np.float64 image normalized to [-1.0, 1.0]; \n
 971            'int8' - output np.int8 image rescaled to [-127, 127]; \n
 972            'int16' output np.int16 image rescaled to [-32767, 32767]
 973
 974        Returns
 975        -------
 976        np.ndarray or None
 977            Converted image or None if some exception occurs.
 978        """
 979        target = img.copy()  # not operating on an input image as a reference
 980        option = option.replace(" ", "")  # prevent mistakes in typing, like "neg. norm."
 981        if option in cls.__cast_options:
 982            target = target.astype(np.float64)  # universal cast for array manipulations
 983            if option == cls.__cast_options[0]:
 984                if np.min(target) < 0.0:
 985                    # Following logic applied: [-2.0, 0.0, 0.8] -> [-1.0, 0.0, 0.4] - not scaled to [-1.0, 1.0] but normalized to [-1 1]
 986                    if np.abs(np.min(target)) > np.abs(np.max(target)):
 987                        target /= np.abs(np.min(target)); target = np.round(target, 9)
 988                    else:
 989                        target /= np.abs(np.max(target)); target = np.round(target, 9)
 990                    return target
 991                else:
 992                    target -= 0.5*np.max(target)  # shift image from [0.0 ... max] to [-0.5 max, 0.5 max]
 993                    target /= np.max(target); target = np.round(target, 9)  # should normalize target to [-1.0, 1.0]
 994                    # Check that pixel values are within the range
 995                    if np.max(target) > 1.0:
 996                        target /= np.max(target); target = np.round(target, 9)
 997                    if np.min(target) < -1.0:
 998                        target /= np.abs(np.min(target)); target = np.round(target, 9)
 999                    return target
1000            elif option == cls.__cast_options[1]:
1001                norm_neg_target = UscopeScene.cast_image(img)  # get normalized to [-1.0, 1.0] image by default
1002                norm_neg_target *= np.iinfo(np.int8).max  # just use uniform transform to [-127.0, 127.0]
1003                norm_neg_target = np.round(norm_neg_target, 0)  # prepare to conversion to integer values
1004                return norm_neg_target.astype(np.int8)
1005            elif option == cls.__cast_options[2]:
1006                norm_neg_target = UscopeScene.cast_image(img)  # get normalized to [-1.0, 1.0] image by default
1007                norm_neg_target *= np.iinfo(np.int16).max  # just use uniform transform to [-32767.0, 32767.0]
1008                norm_neg_target = np.round(norm_neg_target, 0)  # prepare to conversion to integer values
1009                return norm_neg_target.astype(np.int16)
1010            else:
1011                return None
1012        else:
1013            raise ValueError(f"\nProvided option '{option}' not found among the supported options: {cls.__cast_options}")

Replicate the common fluorescence microscopic image (frame or 'scene').

This class simulates the bright objects with round and elongate shapes as the basic examples of imaged objects.

The ratio behind development of this class - to get the ground truth images for image processing workflows tests.

For more complex and useful cases, please, check the References.

References

In general, there is no references for implementation. For the used noise models, see the 'add_noise method'.

 81    def __init__(self, width: int, height: int, image_type: Union[str, np.uint8, np.uint16, np.float64] = 'uint8',

131            self.__ellipse_fl_obj = FluorObj(typical_size=(2.02, 1.52, np.pi / 3.0), center_shifts=(-0.1, 0.2), shape_type='ellipse')
