1327    # %% Plotting methods
1328    def plot_shape(self, str_id: str = "", color_map: str = 'viridis'):
1329        """
1330        Plot interactively the profile of the object computed by the get_shape() method along with the border of the object.
1331
1332        Please note that the border will be plotted if the shape hadn't been cropped before.
1333
1334        Parameters
1335        ----------
1336        str_id : str, optional \n
1337            Unique string id for plotting several plots with unique Figure() names. The default is "". \n
1338        color_map : str, optional \n
1339            Color map acceptable by matplotlib.pyplot.cm. Fallback is viridis color map. The default is 'viridis'. \n
1340
1341        Returns
1342        -------
1343        None.
1344
1345        """
1346        if not plt.isinteractive():
1347            plt.ion()
1348        if self.profile is not None:
1349            if self.__profile_cropped:
1350                naming = "Cropped Shape"
1351            else:
1352                naming = "Shape"
1353            if len(str_id) == 0:
1354                str_id = str(random.randint(1, 1000))
1355            plt.figure(f"{naming} with parameters: {self.explicit_shape_name}, {self.border_type}, center: {self.center_shifts} {str_id}")
1356            try:
1357                axes_img = plt.imshow(self.profile, cmap=color_map, origin='upper')
1358            except ValueError:
1359                axes_img = plt.imshow(self.profile, cmap=plt.cm.viridis, origin='upper')
1360            plt.axis('off'); plt.colorbar(); plt.tight_layout()
1361            plot_patch = True  # flag for plotting the patch (Circle or Ellipse)
1362            m_center, n_center = 0.0, 0.0
1363            if not self.__profile_cropped:
1364                m_center, n_center = self.profile.shape  # image sizes
1365                if self.center_shifts[0] < 0.0 and (self.shape_type == "round" or self.shape_type == "r"):
1366                    m_center = m_center // 2 + self.center_shifts[0] + 1.0
1367                elif self.center_shifts[0] >= 0.0:
1368                    m_center = m_center // 2 + self.center_shifts[0]
1369                if self.center_shifts[1] < 0.0 and (self.shape_type == "round" or self.shape_type == "r"):
1370                    n_center = n_center // 2 + self.center_shifts[1] + 1.0
1371                elif self.center_shifts[1] >= 0.0:
1372                    n_center = n_center // 2 + self.center_shifts[1]
1373            else:
1374                plot_patch = False  # just prevent the plotting the patch on the cropped images
1375            if plot_patch:
1376                if self.shape_type == "round" or self.shape_type == "r":
1377                    axes_img.axes.add_patch(Circle((m_center, n_center), self.radius, edgecolor='red', linewidth=1.5, facecolor='none'))
1378                    axes_img.axes.plot(m_center, n_center, marker='.', linewidth=3, color='red')
1379                elif self.shape_type == "ellipse" or self.shape_type == "el":
1380                    axes_img.axes.add_patch(Ellipse((m_center, n_center), self.typical_sizes[0], self.typical_sizes[1],
1381                                                    angle=-self.typical_sizes[2]*180.0/np.pi,
1382                                                    edgecolor='red', facecolor='none', linewidth=1.75))
1383                    axes_img.axes.plot(m_center, n_center, marker='.', linewidth=3, color='red')

1407    # %% Containing within the image checks
1408    def set_image_sizes(self, image_sizes: tuple):
1409        """
1410        Set containing this object image sizes packed in the tuple.
1411
1412        Parameters
1413        ----------
1414        image_sizes : tuple \n
1415            Expected as (height, width). \n
1416
1417        Raises
1418        ------
1419        ValueError \n
1420            If image sizes provided less than 2 pixels. \n
1421
1422        Returns
1423        -------
1424        None.
1425
1426        """
1427        h, w = image_sizes  # expecting packed height, width - also can be called with image.shape (np.ndarray.shape) attribute
1428        if h > 2 and w > 2:
1429            self.__external_image_sizes = (h, w)
1430        else:
1431            self.__external_image_sizes = (0, 0)  # put the default sizes for always getting False after setting coordinates
1432            raise ValueError("Height and width image is expected to be more than 2 pixels")
1433
1434    def set_coordinates(self, coordinates: tuple) -> bool:
1435        """
1436        Set coordinates of the left upper coordinates of the profile.
1437
1438        Parameters
1439        ----------
1440        coordinates : tuple \n
1441            As i - from rows, j - columns. \n
1442
1443        Returns
1444        -------
1445        bool \n
1446            True if the image containing the profile (even partially). \n
1447
1448        """
1449        # Expecting packed coordinates of the left upper pixel coordinates of a profile
1450        i, j = coordinates; self.external_upper_coordinates = coordinates
1451        if self.profile is not None:
1452            h, w = self.profile.shape; h_image, w_image = self.__external_image_sizes
1453            i_border_check = False; j_border_check = False  # flags for overall checking
1454            # Below - basic check that the profile still is within image, if even its borders still are in
1455            if (i < 0 <= i + h) or (i >= 0 and i - h < h_image):
1456                i_border_check = True
1457            if (j < 0 <= j + w) or (j >= 0 and j - w < w_image):
1458                j_border_check = True
1459            # Additional check that pixels of a shape is still not zero within the image (touching the scene only by border pixels)
1460            if (i < 0 and j < 0) or (i > h_image and j > w_image):
1461                additional_containing_check = False
1462                for i_c in range(i, i+h):
1463                    k = 0
1464                    for j_c in range(j, j+w):
1465                        m = 0
1466                        if 0 <= i_c < h_image and 0 <= j_c < w_image:
1467                            if self.profile[k, m] > 0.0:
1468                                additional_containing_check = True; break
1469                        m += 1
1470                    if additional_containing_check:
1471                        break
1472                    k += 1
1473            else:
1474                additional_containing_check = True
1475            self.within_image = (i_border_check and j_border_check and additional_containing_check)
1476        else:
1477            self.within_image = False  # explicit setting flag
1478        return self.within_image
1479
1480    # %% Rewriting dunder methods for implementing sorting logic
1481    def __lt__(self, other) -> bool:
1482        """
1483        Implementation of '<' comparison operator for letting the default sorting method to work on list of instances.
1484
1485        This method compares only shape sizes multiplication (m, n = self.profile.shape; m*n < other.profile.shape[0]*other.profile.shape[1]).
1486
1487        Parameters
1488        ----------
1489        other : FluorObj \n
1490            Instance of FluorObj() comparison. \n
1491
1492        Returns
1493        -------
1494        bool \n
1495            Result of profile sizes comparison. \n
1496
1497        """
1498        if self.profile is not None and other.profile is not None:
1499            return self.profile.shape[0]*self.profile.shape[1] < other.profile.shape[0]*other.profile.shape[1]
1500        else:
1501            return False
1502
1503    def __eq__(self, other) -> bool:
1504        """
1505        Implementation of '==' comparison operator for letting the default sorting method to work on list of instances.
1506
1507        This method compares shape size (m, n = self.profile.shape; m == other.profile.shape[0] and n == other.profile.shape[1])
1508        and also explicit_shape_name attributes of two classes.
1509
1510        Parameters
1511        ----------
1512        other : FluorObj  \n
1513            Instance of FluorObj() comparison. \n
1514
1515        Returns
1516        -------
1517        bool \n
1518            Result of mentioned above attributes comparison. \n
1519
1520        """
1521        if self.profile is not None and other.profile is not None:
1522            shape_type_check = self.explicit_shape_name == other.explicit_shape_name
1523            shape_sizes_check = (self.profile.shape[0] == other.profile.shape[0] and self.profile.shape[1] == other.profile.shape[1])
1524            return shape_sizes_check and shape_type_check
1525        else:
1526            return False

Modelling the fluorescent bright object with the specified type.

It can be used for embedding it to the 'UscopeScene' class for building up the microscopic image.

FluorObj( typical_size: Union[numbers.Real, tuple], center_shifts: tuple = (0.0, 0.0), shape_type: str = 'round', border_type: str = 'precise', shape_method: str = '') 
1043    def __init__(self, typical_size: Union[Real, tuple], center_shifts: tuple = (0.0, 0.0), shape_type: str = 'round',
1044                 border_type: str = 'precise', shape_method: str = ''):
1045        f"""
1046        Initialize the class representation of a fluorescent object.
1047
1048        The difference between used parameters can be observed by plotting of the calculated shapes (profiles) by get_shape() method.
1049
1050        Parameters
1051        ----------
1052        typical_size : Union[Real, tuple] \n
1053            Typical sizes of the object, e.g. for a bead - diameter (float or int - Real number in general),
1054            for ellipse - tuple with axes a, b and angle in radians (3 values). \n
1055        center_shifts : tuple, optional \n
1056            Shifts in pixels of the object center, should be less than 1px. The default is (0.0, 0.0). \n
1057        shape_type : str, optional \n
1058            Supported shape types: {self.__acceptable_shape_types}. \n
1059            Currently implemented: 'round' or 'r' - for the circular bead object and 'ellipse' or 'el' - for the ellipse object.
1060            The default is 'round'. \n
1061        border_type : str, optional \n
1062            Type of intensity of the border pixels calculation. Supported border types: 'precise', 'pr', 'computed', 'co'. \n
1063            The 'computed' or 'co' type should be accompanied with the specification of the shape method parameter. \n
1064            The 'precise' or 'pr' type corresponds to the developed counting area of the pixel laying within
1065            the border (e.g., circular) of an object. \n
1066            Note that 'computed' type can be used only for 'round' objects. The default is 'precise'. \n
1067        shape_method : str, optional \n
1068            Shape method calculation, supported ones: {self.__acceptable_shape_methods}. The default is ''. \n
1069
1070        Raises
1071        ------
1072        ValueError \n
1073            See the provided error description for details. \n
1074
1075        Returns
1076        -------
1077        None.
1078
1079        """
1080        # Sanity checks of the input values
1081        if shape_type in self.__acceptable_shape_types:
1082            self.shape_type = shape_type
1083        else:
1084            raise ValueError(f"Provided shape type '{shape_type}' not in acceptable list {self.__acceptable_shape_types}")
1085        if border_type in self.__acceptable_border_types:
1086            self.border_type = border_type
1087        else:
1088            raise ValueError(f"Provided border type '{border_type}' not in acceptable list {self.__acceptable_border_types}")
1089        # Checking typical sizes depending on the shape type
1090        if self.shape_type == "round" or self.shape_type == "r":
1091            typical_size = float(typical_size)  # assuming that the input parameter can be converted to the float type
1092            if typical_size < 1.0:
1093                raise ValueError(f"Expected typical size (radius) should be larger than 1px, provided: {typical_size}")
1094            else:
1095                self.radius = 0.5*typical_size
1096        else:
1097            if self.shape_type == "ellipse" or self.shape_type == "el":
1098                self.border_type = 'precise'  # default border type for ellipse shape calculation
1099                if len(typical_size) != 3:
1100                    raise ValueError("For ellipse particle expected length of typical size tuple is equal 3: (a, b, angle)")
1101                else:
1102                    a, b, angle = typical_size; max_size = max(a, b); min_size = min(a, b)
1103                    if max_size < 1.5 or min_size < 1.0:
1104                        raise ValueError("Expected sizes a, b should be positive, minimal is more than 1px and maximal is more than 1.5px"
1105                                         + f"Provided sizes: {a, b}")
1106                    if angle > 2.0*np.pi or angle < -2.0*np.pi:
1107                        raise ValueError("Expected angle should be in the range of [-2pi, 2pi]")
1108                    self.typical_sizes = typical_size
1109            else:
1110                if len(typical_size) <= 2:
1111                    raise ValueError("For curved particle expected length of typical size tuple is more than 2")
1112                else:
1113                    self.typical_sizes = typical_size
1114            if self.shape_type == "el":
1115                self.explicit_shape_name = 'ellipse'
1116        # Assigning the explicit border type for making full naming for plots
1117        if self.border_type == "computed" or self.border_type == "co":
1118            if shape_method in self.__acceptable_shape_methods:
1119                self.shape_method = shape_method
1120                if self.shape_method == 'g':
1121                    self.explicit_shape_name = 'gaussian'
1122                elif self.shape_method == 'lor':
1123                    self.explicit_shape_name = 'lorentzian'
1124                elif self.shape_method == 'dlogf':
1125                    self.explicit_shape_name = 'derivative of logistic func.'
1126                elif self.shape_method == 'bump2':
1127                    self.explicit_shape_name = 'bump square'
1128                elif self.shape_method == 'bump3':
1129                    self.explicit_shape_name = 'bump cube'
1130                elif self.shape_method == 'bump8':
1131                    self.explicit_shape_name = 'bump ^8'
1132                elif self.shape_method == 'smcir':
1133                    self.explicit_shape_name = 'smooth circle'
1134                elif self.shape_method == 'ovcir':
1135                    self.explicit_shape_name = 'oversampled circle'
1136                elif self.shape_method == 'uncir':
1137                    self.explicit_shape_name = 'undersampled circle'
1138                elif self.shape_method == 'c':
1139                    self.explicit_shape_name = 'circle'
1140            else:
1141                raise ValueError(f"Provided shape comp. method '{shape_method}' not in acceptable list {self.__acceptable_shape_methods}")
1142        # Check that explicit shape name is not empty
1143        if len(self.explicit_shape_name) == 0:
1144            if self.shape_type == "ellipse":
1145                self.explicit_shape_name = self.shape_type[:]
1146            elif self.border_type == "computed" or self.border_type == "co":
1147                self.explicit_shape_name = self.shape_method[:]
1148            elif self.border_type == "precise" or self.border_type == "pr":
1149                self.explicit_shape_name = "round"
1150        # Assuming that center shifts provided as the tuple with x shift, y shift floats in pixels
1151        if len(center_shifts) == 2:
1152            x_shift, y_shift = center_shifts
1153            if abs(x_shift) < 1.0 and abs(y_shift) < 1.0:
1154                self.center_shifts = center_shifts
1155            else:
1156                raise ValueError(f"One of the shifts '{center_shifts}' are more than 1px, but they are expected to be in the subpixel range")

explicit_shape_name: str = ''

def get_shape( self, center_shifts: tuple = None, accelerated: bool = False) -> Optional[numpy.ndarray]: 
1178    def get_shape(self, center_shifts: tuple = None, accelerated: bool = False) -> Union[np.ndarray, None]:
1179        """
1180        Calculate and return 2D intensity normalized (to the range [0.0, 1.0]) distribution of the object shape.
1181
1182
1183        Parameters
1184        ----------
1185        center_shifts : tuple, optional \n
1186            Shifts in pixels of the object center, should be less than 1px. The default is None. \n
1187        accelerated : bool, optional \n
1188            Accelerate the computation by using numba library compilation utilities.
1189            If True, will raise warning if the numba library hasn't been installed in the environment. The default is False. \n
1190
1191        Raises
1192        ------
1193        NotImplementedError \n
1194            For some set of allowed parameters for class initialization the calculation hasn't been yet implemented. \n
1195
1196        References
1197        ----------
1198        Continuously shaped objects are created by adapting the functions from: \n
1199        [1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bell-shaped_function \n
1200        'Precisely' shaped objects are created by the custom algorithm, which calculates part of an object still laying
1201        within the affected ('border') pixels. \n
1202
1203        Returns
1204        -------
1205        2D shape of the object (intensity representation).
1206
1207        """
1208        if center_shifts is not None and len(center_shifts) == 2:
1209            x_shift, y_shift = center_shifts
1210            if abs(x_shift) < 1.0 and abs(y_shift) < 1.0:
1211                self.center_shifts = center_shifts
1212            else:
1213                raise ValueError(f"One of the shifts '{center_shifts}' are more than 1px, "
1214                                 + "but the shifts are expected to be in the subpixel range")
1215        if (self.shape_type == "round" or self.shape_type == "r") and (self.border_type == "computed" or self.border_type == "co"):
1216            self.profile = continuous_shaped_bead(self.radius, self.center_shifts, bead_type=self.shape_method)
1217        elif (self.shape_type == "round" or self.shape_type == "r") and (self.border_type == "precise" or self.border_type == "pr"):
1218            if not accelerated:
1219                self.profile = discrete_shaped_bead(self.radius, self.center_shifts)
1220            elif numba_installed:
1221                self.profile = discrete_shaped_bead_acc(self.radius, self.center_shifts)
1222            else:
1223                if accelerated and not numba_installed:
1224                    __warn_message = "Acceleration isn't possible because 'numba' library not installed in the current environment"
1225                    warnings.warn(__warn_message)
1226                self.profile = discrete_shaped_bead(self.radius, self.center_shifts)
1227        elif self.shape_type == "ellipse" or self.shape_type == "el":
1228            sizes = (self.typical_sizes[0], self.typical_sizes[1]); ellipse_angle = self.typical_sizes[2]
1229            if not accelerated:
1230                self.profile = discrete_shaped_ellipse(sizes, ellipse_angle, self.center_shifts)
1231            elif numba_installed:
1232                self.profile = discrete_shaped_ellipse_acc(sizes, ellipse_angle, self.center_shifts)
1233            else:
1234                if accelerated and not numba_installed:
1235                    __warn_message = "Acceleration isn't possible because 'numba' library not installed in the current environment"
1236                    warnings.warn(__warn_message)
1237                self.profile = discrete_shaped_ellipse(sizes, ellipse_angle, self.center_shifts)
1238        else:
1239            raise NotImplementedError("This set of input parameters hasn't yet been implemented")
1240        self.__profile_cropped = False  # set it to the default value, the profile is uncropped

def get_casted_shape( self, max_pixel_value: Union[int, float], image_type: Union[str, numpy.uint8, numpy.uint16, numpy.float64] = 'uint8') -> Optional[numpy.ndarray]: 
1242    def get_casted_shape(self, max_pixel_value: Union[int, float],
1243                         image_type: Union[str, np.uint8, np.uint16, np.float64] = 'uint8') -> Union[np.ndarray, None]:
1244        """
1245        Calculate cast from the computed normalized object shape.
1246
1247        Parameters
1248        ----------
1249        max_pixel_value :  Union[int, float] \n
1250            Maximum intensity or pixel value of the object. \n
1251        image_type : Union[str, np.uint8, np.uint16, np.float64], optional \n
1252            Type for casting. The default is 'uint8'. \n
1253
1254        Raises
1255        ------
1256        ValueError \n
1257            If the provided max_pixel_value doesn't correspond to the provided image type. \n
1258
1259        Returns
1260        -------
1261        numpy.ndarray | None (designated as Union) \n
1262            Returns the cast profile or None if the normalized profile hasn't been calculated. \n
1263
1264        """
1265        if image_type not in UscopeScene.acceptable_img_types:
1266            raise ValueError(f"Provided image type '{image_type}' not in the acceptable list of types: "
1267                             + str(UscopeScene.acceptable_img_types))
1268        if self.profile is not None:
1269            if image_type == 'uint8' or image_type is np.uint8:
1270                if max_pixel_value > np.iinfo(np.uint8).max or max_pixel_value < 0:
1271                    raise ValueError(f"Provided max pixel value {max_pixel_value} isn't compatible with a provided image type: {image_type}")
1272                self.image_type = image_type; self.casted_profile = np.round(max_pixel_value * self.profile, 0).astype(np.uint8)
1273                return self.casted_profile
1274            elif image_type == 'uint16' or image_type is np.uint16:
1275                if max_pixel_value > np.iinfo(np.uint16).max or max_pixel_value < 0:
1276                    raise ValueError(f"Provided max pixel value {max_pixel_value} isn't compatible with a provided image type: {image_type}")
1277                self.image_type = image_type; self.casted_profile = np.round(max_pixel_value*self.profile, 0).astype(np.uint16)
1278                return self.casted_profile
1279            elif image_type == 'float' or image_type is np.float64:
1280                self.image_type = image_type; self.casted_profile = max_pixel_value*self.profile
1281                return self.casted_profile
1282            else:
1283                self.casted_profile = None; return self.casted_profile
1284        else:
1285            self.casted_profile = None; return self.casted_profile

def crop_shape(self) -> numpy.ndarray: 
1287    def crop_shape(self) -> np.ndarray:
1288        """
1289        Crop zero intensity parts (borders) of the computed profile.
1290
1291        Returns
1292        -------
1293        numpy.ndarray \n
1294            2D cropped profile. \n
1295
1296        """
1297        if self.profile is not None and not self.__profile_cropped:  # checking that the profile has been calculated and not cropped yet
1298            m, n = self.profile.shape; i_start = 0; j_start = 0; i_end = m; j_end = n; border_found = False
1299            for i in range(m):
1300                if np.max(self.profile[i, :]) > 0.0:
1301                    if not border_found:
1302                        border_found = True
1303                    continue
1304                else:
1305                    if not border_found:
1306                        i_start = i+1
1307                    else:
1308                        i_end = i; break
1309            border_found = False
1310            for j in range(n):
1311                if np.max(self.profile[:, j]) > 0.0:
1312                    if not border_found:
1313                        border_found = True
1314                    continue
1315                else:
1316                    if not border_found:
1317                        j_start = j+1
1318                    else:
1319                        j_end = j; break
1320            self.profile = self.profile[i_start:i_end, j_start:j_end]
1321            if self.casted_profile is not None:
1322                self.casted_profile = self.casted_profile[i_start:i_end, j_start:j_end]
1323            if i_start > 0 or j_start > 0 or i_end < m or j_end < n:
1324                self.__profile_cropped = True
1325        return self.profile

1328    def plot_shape(self, str_id: str = "", color_map: str = 'viridis'):
1329        """
1330        Plot interactively the profile of the object computed by the get_shape() method along with the border of the object.

1366                    m_center = m_center // 2 + self.center_shifts[0] + 1.0
1367                elif self.center_shifts[0] >= 0.0:
1368                    m_center = m_center // 2 + self.center_shifts[0]
1369                if self.center_shifts[1] < 0.0 and (self.shape_type == "round" or self.shape_type == "r"):
1370                    n_center = n_center // 2 + self.center_shifts[1] + 1.0
1371                elif self.center_shifts[1] >= 0.0:
1372                    n_center = n_center // 2 + self.center_shifts[1]
1373            else:
1374                plot_patch = False  # just prevent the plotting the patch on the cropped images
1375            if plot_patch:
1376                if self.shape_type == "round" or self.shape_type == "r":
1377                    axes_img.axes.add_patch(Circle((m_center, n_center), self.radius, edgecolor='red', linewidth=1.5, facecolor='none'))
1378                    axes_img.axes.plot(m_center, n_center, marker='.', linewidth=3, color='red')
1379                elif self.shape_type == "ellipse" or self.shape_type == "el":
1380                    axes_img.axes.add_patch(Ellipse((m_center, n_center), self.typical_sizes[0], self.typical_sizes[1],
1381                                                    angle=-self.typical_sizes[2]*180.0/np.pi,
1382                                                    edgecolor='red', facecolor='none', linewidth=1.75))
1383                    axes_img.axes.plot(m_center, n_center, marker='.', linewidth=3, color='red')

def set_coordinates(self, coordinates: tuple) -> bool: 
1434    def set_coordinates(self, coordinates: tuple) -> bool:
1435        """
1436        Set coordinates of the left upper coordinates of the profile.
1437
1438        Parameters
1439        ----------
1440        coordinates : tuple \n
1441            As i - from rows, j - columns. \n
1442
1443        Returns
1444        -------
1445        bool \n
1446            True if the image containing the profile (even partially). \n
1447
1448        """
1449        # Expecting packed coordinates of the left upper pixel coordinates of a profile
1450        i, j = coordinates; self.external_upper_coordinates = coordinates
1451        if self.profile is not None:
1452            h, w = self.profile.shape; h_image, w_image = self.__external_image_sizes
1453            i_border_check = False; j_border_check = False  # flags for overall checking
1454            # Below - basic check that the profile still is within image, if even its borders still are in
1455            if (i < 0 <= i + h) or (i >= 0 and i - h < h_image):
1456                i_border_check = True
1457            if (j < 0 <= j + w) or (j >= 0 and j - w < w_image):
1458                j_border_check = True
1459            # Additional check that pixels of a shape is still not zero within the image (touching the scene only by border pixels)
1460            if (i < 0 and j < 0) or (i > h_image and j > w_image):
1461                additional_containing_check = False
1462                for i_c in range(i, i+h):
1463                    k = 0
1464                    for j_c in range(j, j+w):
1465                        m = 0
1466                        if 0 <= i_c < h_image and 0 <= j_c < w_image:
1467                            if self.profile[k, m] > 0.0:
1468                                additional_containing_check = True; break
1469                        m += 1
1470                    if additional_containing_check:
1471                        break
1472                    k += 1
1473            else:
1474                additional_containing_check = True
1475            self.within_image = (i_border_check and j_border_check and additional_containing_check)
1476        else:
1477            self.within_image = False  # explicit setting flag
1478        return self.within_image
